137501.name: Pocket Bowling

videogameversion.198231: North American Game Boy Color edition

137501.description:
User Summary

An arcade style bowling game featuring several modes such as Tournament, Training, and Open Bowling. Options include different characters, left/right handed, and lane wax options. A password system saves your progress.

137502.name: Polaris SnoCross (GBC)

videogameversion.198232: North American Game Boy Color edition

137502.description:
User Summary

A snowmobile racing game featuring tournament play across 10 different courses. Comes in a rumble cartridge and uses a password system to save your progress.

137504.name: Portal Runner (GBC)

videogameversion.198234: North American Game Boy Color edition

137504.description:
User Summary

Vikki from the Army Men series of games stars in her own platformer. She must stop her enemy, Brigitte Blue across different worlds, as she travels through portals to these different locations.

137506.name: Power Rangers: Lightspeed Rescue

videogameversion.198238: North American Game Boy Color edition

137506.description:
Back of the box

POWER RANGERS, IT'S TIME TO GET RESCUE READY!
Get ready to save the world Power Rangers style! As a member of the elite Lightspeed Rescue team, players rescue people from monsters, earn awesome power-ups, and even take control of a giant Megazord!
- Over 20 levels of game play inspired by the Power Rangers Lightspeed Rescue TV show
- Multiple game modes including Rescue, Battle, and Megazord games
- Huge boss battles with monsters from the TV show including Diabolico, Magmavore, and others

137507.name: The Artifact
137507.description:
From the designer's webpage:
The Year is 2085 and long range teleportation technology has made faster than light travel possible, In an attempt to find habitable planets earth’s governments send out probes into deep space.They found something. . .

Welcome to the Artifact, a world foreign to our own Earth in many ways. A world that was manufactured for some as yet unknown purpose. Here you will encounter hostile aliens like the Kelrath and the Chezbah, and those that will seek your aid, like the Scimrahn. Races that appear human but are different from us in many ways. Then there are those that hide in the shadows, like the giant Tanroc Fredar, and the thing called Loc, revered as a god by some, despised as a demon by others.

A small group of explorers from earth are the first to venture into this vast world. Some looking for a better life, some for the adventure, and some looking to strike it rich in the amazing resources that are available.

The Artifact is a Role Playing Game that each player will take part in a unfolding world. As members, they will have the opportunity to add to and influence the world around them. Updates will periodically be posted to the site, in addition to member contributions. The main portion of the game is a two hundred and six page book that is downloadable in PDF format (viewable with the Adobe Acrobat Reader that is available for free). Several sourcebooks are also available to download for free. Hard Copy books are also available for purchase.

The Artifact is all about survival in an alien world.
That’s why Survival Challenges were created as a GM tool for telling this kind of story. Players roll to defeat the challenge instead of rolling to stave off defeat.

The Artifact is all about science.
That’s why Tech Challenges were created. Players only have to propose how their characters might try and solve the puzzle and their character’s knowledge provides the solution. This becomes very enjoyable for the players because they’re not just rolling dice, they’re telling the story of how the puzzle will be solved and then rolling to see how it worked. Then the tool provides input for the GM about how the problem reacts to the PC’s efforts making things more interesting because the puzzle is interactive.

The Artifact is about the teeming masses.
In most games, the PCs work alone. In The Artifact, most of the time the PCs are part of organizations that support them.
That’s why Infantry Combat is included in the rules, so the players can be in charge of their subordinates and directly manage them easily. The GM can also more easily handle larger groups as easily as handling a single NPC.

137508.name: Power Rangers: Time Force

videogameversion.198240: North American Game Boy Color edition

137508.description:
The five Time Force Rangers travel though time to stop enemies. You can play as the Pink, Green, Yellow, Blue or Red Time Force Rangers. The Quantum Ranger is playable but only if your Ranger finds a Quantum Morpher and all 7 secret items hidden in each level. When the bosses grow to gigantic size the Time Force Megazord Mode Blue/Red, Time Shadow Megazord and Q-Rex (When you play Quantum Ranger) are Playable.

Source: Wikipedia, "Power Rangers Time Force (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137509.name: Power Spike Pro Beach Volleyball

videogameversion.198241: North American Game Boy Color edition

137509.description:
User Summary

A 2 on 2 beach volleyball game with exhibition and championship modes. Choose from many different teams and arenas.

137510.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Bad Mojo Jojo

videogameversion.198242: North American Game Boy Color edition

137510.description:
Back of the box

Saving the World before Bedtime

Mojo Jojo has broken into Professor Utonium's lab, and built some superweapons with which he will destroy Townsville. Help Blossom lead her sisters and use her perfect combination of Brains, Beauty and Braun to track down and defeat the evel genius, Mojo Jojo, and thus save the citizens of Townsville.

Collect hidden electronic trading cards and even unlock special hidden features using secret passwords!

137511.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Battle Him

videogameversion.198243: North American Game Boy Color edition

137511.description:
Back of the box

Saving the World before Bedtime

The City of Townsville! Sweet little Bubbles is happily coloring, when suddenly the Powerpuff Hotline rings. HIM has put a spell on the Citizens of Townsville and they can't move! Uh oh! No more nice little Bubbles. It's time for Bubbles to go-hardcore. She must rescue her friends from HIM's evil clutches and save the day!
- Help Bubbles free the Citizens of Townsville from the Villainous HIM!
- Collect hidden electronic trading cards and trade them with your friends.
- Find the secret passcodes that will unlock special hidden features.

137512.name: Pro Darts

videogameversion.198244: North American Game Boy Color edition

137512.description:
User Summary

A dart game with 6 different modes including Cricket, Around the World, 301, 501, and more. Many different characters to choose from each with different attributes.

137513.name: 10 Second Run
137513.description:
User Summary:

10 Second Run contains 50 levels, all with a 10 second timer. It starts out with simple running and jumping, but quickly ups the intensity with fire and enemies, along with some very precise platforming.

Graphically, the game is about as simple as you can get. You control a stick figure and the environments consist of just lines and boxes, with some fire and moving spikeys in later levels.

137514.name: Pro Pool

videogameversion.198246: North American Game Boy Color edition

137514.description:
User Summary

A billiards game with seven different game modes including 8-ball, Nine-ball, Speed, Killer, Straight, Six-ball, and Three-ball. 64 different computer opponents are available.

137516.name: Project S-11

videogameversion.198249: North American Game Boy Color edition

137516.description:
The game is played in a manner similar to a shoot 'em up arcade game. Players control the S-11 fighter, which can freely move across the top-down oriented screen. Waves of enemies come from the top of screen (and occasionally the side) which the player must attempt to destroy to gain points. Players can collect various power-ups, which will make their weapons stronger or give them an extra life. Players will fight a mini boss half-way through a level, and a larger boss at the end of each level.

Source: Wikipedia, "Project S-11", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137517.name: Puzzle Master

videogameversion.198250: North American Game Boy Color edition

137517.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game with different colored pieces falling (representing the elements) from the top of the screen. Like colors must be grouped together to be cleared. Different elements have different properties and can be used to discover power-ups.

137518.name: Puzzled

videogameversion.198251: North American Game Boy Color edition

137518.description:
Back of the box

Part of our galaxy is under threat from the evil Professor's wicked schemes! No one but our hero can stop him! Unfortunately, the nefarious Professor has used his transdimensional reality converter to turn our hero into a helpless BLOB and transport him to a parallel world. Now it is up to you to save the day! Our blobified hero has to find his way through all the levels of the parallel world. Only then will he have the chance to become human again and put a stop to the Professor's vicious activities once and for all.
- 150 perplexing action-packed levels
- Dozens of active switches, transporters, different squares and objects
- Supports Game Boy Printer

137519.name: PrisonBall 2072
137519.description:
In a futurist universe controlled by the New World Order, extraterrestrial prisoners and other outcasts from society have become superstars of a bloody and violent sport in the image of its time : PrisonBall.

Leading one of these prisoners teams, the player will try to qualify himself through PrisonBall play-offs and cups for the very coveted Christmas Cup, a bloody family entertainment for the celebration season .

PrisonBall is played 7 versus 7 on an ice rink and players have to get points in order to win the victory.

Goals, bumpers, timers and Ko are different means to win. Tactic Cards, corruption cards, low blows, the audience and bonuses are also indirect means to glean a few points or to get rid of your adversary.

Go through a whole season thanks to championship rules that will lead you to the Christmas Cup or simply play a match between one of the major teams of the league or one of your teams created with creation rules.
Follow the three great classifications of players, strikers, pitchers or the greatest psychopath, with the charts won with 'xp and become one of the stars.

Inspired by the movie "RollerBall", or the video game "Speedball", Prison Ball throws us into a gloomy future where shed blood has become a family attraction.

Solo rules to simulate matches, the complete set of figurines from Infinity (the game), Greebo, Neomics, Willy miniatures, Pedro Ramos...) can be used with the game. Figurine profiles are available on the site.

You’ve got to win if you want to be free!

137520.name: Mal'Zwar Keep
137520.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The halflings of Mal'Zwar Keep have been making toys for the good children of the kingdom for decades. That was until recently when their path crossed with that of a trapped ice demon. Now they are enslaved and pawns in the ice demon's escape plans! Cursed toys, trapped ice demons, and starving halfling slaves… are your heroes brave enough to face the ice demon and save Winter Night for all the good boys and girls of the kingdom?

The adventure is presented in a system-less fashion using common themes and elements found in any fantasy game. It should be easy for any GM to work this into any campaign.

137521.name: The Village of Cowfold
137521.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Waypoints #0: The Village of Cowfold is released for FREE as an introductory product to showcase our future plans. This issue of Waypoints will peel back the many layers of an interesting and unique medieval village, offering a look at what makes it tick, the various histories, and the tangled web of the inhabitants. Hooks, descriptions, details and a map help flesh out this supplement so that that provides any Gamemaster with a no-prep option to help inject a breath of fresh air into their campaigns.

Welcome to the Village of Cowfold, a village your players may never want to leave!

137522.name: Die Bergkraxler
137522.description:
Objective: be the first ending upon space '100'
- moving by turns -
translation: 'up the mountain scrambling guys'
It is a simple game of racing with lovely illustrations and very cute meeples. The main principle is moving forward by die roll, but due to the use of a second (coloured) die your move becomes 'modified' ==> step left/right/reduced/...; some spaces (see instructions) grant advantages/disadvantages.
Typically game was used by adults betting money.
remarks:
should be published ~ 1900;

137523.name: Das Raketenflugzeug
137523.description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (back to earth ==> field 60)
- moving by turn -
‘Roll and Move’ game

start from the earth (field 1)& move according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside
Equipment: board, 6 meeples
remarks:
should be published during 1920's
places to be travelled to do not match with current knowledge about our planets

137524.name: Thornburg
137524.description:
Publisher blurb:
There is something odd and terrible going on in the town of Thornburg. What is it? Play to find out! Thornburg is an eight page adventure that plays out differently every time you play it. In collaboration with Jeremiah Shepersky, with art from Vanity Games, and maps by Matt Jackson, At the Table Games presents an adventure that pulls from the best of what Dungeon World can do.

137525.description:
This is the "Charity" promo card for the game Seven Sisters.

In game use:

Players may replace up to 4 wild cards with the Charity promo card. On their turn, instead of playing a card to normally influence one of the sisters, they may instead play a Charity card and take either 2 gold or 2 fruit from the supply.
137525.name: Seven Sisters: Charity Promo Card

137526.name: Hostile Takeover
137526.description:
Taken from the first section of the book. This product is part of the Interface Zero setting.

USING THIS BOOK
Hostile Takeover is divided into two sections: the first is for those intending to be players in an Interface Zero game that uses this text; the second is for the Gamemaster. Though the GM section isn’t strictly secret, players probably won’t find much of interest here.

THE NEW EMPLOYEE ORIENTATION HANDBOOK
Membership has its privileges. Here you’ll find a guide to Corporate Culture, new Edges, Hindrances and Skills, and a sweet Expense Account, assuming you can keep and maintain your ever-changing relationship with the Corporation itself.

THE POLICY AND PROCEDURE MANUAL
Here you’ll find tools and rules suggestions to make your job of running a corporation campaign easier. There is some discussion on what to focus on and what to let run in the background, a system of Trappings to characterize the various corporations that will be involved in the ongoing campaign, a list of the major comgloms of 2088, and Murder in the Boardroom: how to use the Situational Rules from the Savage Worlds Deluxe Edition to describe the big events in a corporation’s year. Welcome to a world of high-stakes, winner-takeall power plays, where one wrong move can shatter dreams, legacies, and stock options. I hope you’re ready.

137527.name: Wii Tatsunoko vs. Capcom Arcade FightStick
137527.description:
User Summary

The best reviewed Wii arcade stick on Amazon (and SRK). This plugs into the Wii Remote like a Classic Controller and can be used with games that support the latter.

137528.name: Interface Zero Game Master's Kit
137528.description:
The description is from the cover page for the product. This product is part of the Interface Zero setting.

Game Master's Kit that includes the following:

3 Landscape Panels of Art
3 Pages of rules references

137529.name: DeDeuce
137529.description: A light, engaging game where a lot of different things can happen. Players take turns placing cards on a cloth grid. The first player (or team) to form one of the top poker hands (straight or better) wins, provided all of the cards are in a straight line and in your possession as indicated by colored markers. Crossing lines adds challenge as your opponent is always trying to block your efforts even as he/she develops his/her own winning line. In addition, deuces allow a player to either take over a card or remove it from the board. A real "thinking" game and multifaceted, as every game unfolds differently. Team play is a lot of fun. The deuces play a big role in strategy, hence the name of the game.

137530.name: Mafia II: Jimmy's Vendetta
137530.description:
Jimmy’s Vendetta* will be available on September 7, 2010 as a downloadable game add-on on the PlayStation 3 computer entertainment system, Xbox 360 videogame and entertainment system from Microsoft and Windows PC. Jimmy’s Vendetta downloadable content will be accessible through the PlayStation Network, Xbox Live and Steam for $9.99.

Jimmy’s Vendetta introduces a new character to the world of Mafia II where players see the world through the eyes of Jimmy, a mercenary. Jimmy is the guy the other guys call when they need to finish the job.

Fueled by rage and a vendetta, players help Jimmy take on Italian and Irish mobsters that reside in Empire Bay. As players progress, dozens of new quests are unlocked, including assassination and timed vehicle pursuits ending in dramatic shootouts and explosive car chases. Execute with deadly head shots or charged explosives, and rack up points for precision-timed vehicular power slides, lofty jumps, and supercharged velocity. Multipliers and combos add bonus points to overall scores that will be immediately posted to the new online leaderboard system, providing extensive re-playability as players work to rise to the top of the ranks.

* Standalone Mafia II product required to operate.

Source: The Game Website.

137531.name: San Francisco: The Ruins By The Bay
137531.description:
The description is from the first page of the product. This product is part of the Interface Zero setting.


NOT ALL CITIES ARE CREATED EQUAL...

SOMETIMES YOU’VE GOTTA MAKE ‘EM THAT WAY!
Once one of the largest sprawls on the West coast, San Francisco was ravaged by war and natural disaster. Now, some twenty years after a major earthquake levelled the city, San Francisco is home to a wide range of hybrids and humans who eke out a meager existence in this harsh, post-apocalyptic ruin.

Take care though, traveler, because as much as the people of San Francisco can’t stand each other, they hate outsiders even more. These cats’ll gladly gut you and leave ya naked and bleeding out on the broken concrete if you so much as look at them the wrong way, tomo. So, if you stumble into the wrong zone or forget to pack extra ammo when scavenging in the ruins, well...

Don’t say you weren’t warned omae.

San Francisco: There’s no place like it.

Enjoy your stay!

137532.name: Wettlauf zum Futtertrog
137532.description:
Objective: be the first enterinf the centre of the board
- moving by turns -
Simple 'Roll & Move' game; move forward according die roll; if result doesn't match (entering the centre) move back according remaining value; ending on the marked space you must start again.
remarks:
game is packed in a cardboard sleeve
should be produce ~ 1940's

137533.name: Road Rage: Life In The Fast Lane
137533.description:
The description is from the first page of the product. This product is part of the Interface Zero setting.

Put the Pedal to the Metal...
Yeah, tomo, you’ve heard of Jump Bike racing, but do you really know what it is? It’s one part Formula 1, one part Street Race, one part Demolition Derby, and possibly the most popular blood sport of the 2080s. Ever since Mickie O’Laragh demonstrated how weapons could determine the outcome of a race, the sport of ‘Motorized Steeplechase’ has never been the same, and Street Cred —or just plain Credits —often ride on the outcome of these events.

… and Rage Your Dr eam!
Road Rage gives you all the tools you’ll need to enter the world of Jump Bike racing, Interface Zero style. It doesn’t matter if you’re a player looking to build the ultimate street racer, a GM looking to offer a different sort of challenge to your jaded team, or just curious about Jump Bike racing, Road Rage has what you need. So what are you waiting for? Hop aboard your bike, tomo, and JUMP into the action!

137534.description: This expansion includes four hotel markers in each of the six player colors. These are to be used to mark which cities have hotels owned by which players.
137534.name: Railways of the World: Hotels

137535.description: This expansion includes four fuel depot markers in each of the six player colors. These are to be used to mark which cities have fuel depots owned by which players, as introduced in Railways of the Western U.S.
137535.name: Railways of the World: Fuel Depots

137536.description: This expansion includes four mine markers in each of the six player colors. These are to be used to mark which cities have mines owned by which players, as introduced in Railways of North America.
137536.name: Railways of the World: Mines

137537.description: This expansion includes four switch track markers in each of the six player colors. These are to be used to mark where players have placed switch tracks which allow them to enter and leave the same city from the same piece of track.
137537.name: Railways of the World: Switch Tracks

137538.name: Mafia II: Joe's Adventures
137538.description:
Impulsive and unpredictable, Joe Barbaro has been at Vito’s side since childhood. That is, until Vito gets caught and sent to prison. In Joe’s Adventures, Joe uncovers the truth behind Vito’s prison sentence and what’s really going on in the Clemente family.

Joe’s Adventures offers an engaging narrative and allows players to explore new locations, including a train station, the cathouse, a boat yard, a seasonally changing lakefront and some never-before-seen buildings in Empire Bay. This exciting new chapter in the Mafia II saga includes new clothing, collectibles and even more classic 40’s and 50’s music. In addition to the story-based missions, Joe’s Adventures opens up a slew of optional city-based quests packed with arcade action gameplay and a points-based system that allows players to move up the ranks on the online leaderboard through combos and multiplier bonuses. Deadly executions by head shot or charged explosives rack up points, and precision-timed vehicular power slides, lofty jumps and feats of supercharged speed maintain the adrenaline-charged fun for extensive replaya

Source: The Game Website.

137539.name: Road Rage Figure Flats!
137539.description:
The description is from the submitter. This product is part of the Interface Zero setting.
It is specifically used with the Road Rage: Life In The Fast Lane product.

Race Markers, Race Tokens, and large Car Markers that can be used for tracking your Road Rage contestants.

137540.name: Mafia II: The Betrayal of Jimmy
137540.description:
The Betrayal of Jimmy was originally a PlayStation 3-exclusive DLC add-on that has since been released for other platforms. The player controls Jimmy, a gun for hire who will do any job for the right price. The main character, Jimmy, is the same character from Jimmy's Vendetta. The Betrayal of Jimmy is not canon with Mafia II.

Source: Mafia Wiki, "The Betrayal of Jimmy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137541.name: Vom Zollern bis zum Staufen
137541.description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 43
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on lid inside if you end on a marked space.

remarks:
belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
game should be published 1910'/20s

meeples: pewter figures
cities on the map:
Münsingen, Hechingen, Gomadingen, Nürtingen, Horb..

137542.name: Mafia II: Director's Cut
137542.description:
Mafia II is a third-person action-adventure video game, the sequel to Mafia: The City of Lost Heaven. It is developed by 2K Czech, previously known as Illusion Softworks, and is published by 2K Games. Originally announced in August 2007 at the Leipzig Games Convention, it was released on Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 in August 2010. The Mac OS X edition of the game was published by Feral Interactive in December 2011 A version of the game for mobile platforms was developed by Twistbox Entertainment and released in 2010 by Connect2Media.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mafia II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

Mafia II: Director's Cut includes three expansions which was made by downloadable content at first.

137543.name: Assault Against the Menace on the Mountain
137543.description:
from the back of the book

A Roman-themed, pulp-horror-style module for character levels 1-3, for use with 0e/1e/BX and compatible retro-clones.

It is the Terrible Season of the autumn, and the wild people in the mountains are preparing for the frightful ceremonies which only rumour tells of in the towns. This year the dread is even greater, for the people know that the wrath of the very old folk is due upon the town of Pompelo. Three months ago, five of the little squint-eyed traders had come down from the hills, and in a market brawl three of them had been killed. The remaining two had gone back wordlessly to their mountains—and this autumn not a single villager has disappeared yet. There is menace in this immunity, for it is not like the very old folk to spare their victims at the Sabbath. It is too good to be normal, and the villagers are afraid. A cohort has been assembled to end this menace once and for all, and there is room among the throng for more heroes, including you!

137544.name: Blue Almanac
137544.description:
In the distant future, mankind has long left the Earth and spread all over the Milky Way. Humans settled down on different planets, sometimes coming into contact with other races, and established a connection between them. The player is a nameless young man who was a mere child when he survived a spaceship crash and had to seek shelter on a new planet. Now he is sixteen, and his parents plan to send him to attend schooling on the planet Terra. That is when his adventure begins!

Blue Almanac is a sci-fi Japanese-style RPG. The player's party encounters random enemies and fights them in turn-based combat. The combat is viewed from a side-scrolling perspective and both the player's and enemies' attacks are animated.

The game takes place over multiple planets and has an epic space story (similar to Phantasy Star II) that emphasizes substance over style with its minimalist graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Blue Almanac", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137546.name: Raygunz & Rednecks: Incident at Spanky Bottom
137546.description:
Each player plays one of three alien races that have landed in a tiny Appalachian village. The object of the game is to kidnap as many humans as possible for “research” and get them back to the saucers. As a representative of a race of “visitors”, you want your group of aliens to get more victims back into the saucer than the others!

Designed as an introduction to miniatures gaming for new players, R&R uses the basic principles of miniature gaming in an easy to digest, simple form. The alien figures move by a ruler (but can teleport over the entire board) and engage the human figures by appearing in front of them or making contact. A deck of reaction cards drive the human quarry without the need for a referee and generate much of the humor.

The game premiered at PentaCon in 1998 as a non-threating, humor game for the non-grognard attendees. It became a hit and was played there and at a few other regional conventions. A PDF of the basic rules , the deck of reaction cards and a primer on making your own version were freely distributed. A play-at-home version was offered in 2005 at PentaCon through the R&R/GuffeyConRevue booth. The production version of the game came in a plastic clamshell containing cardstock figures and buildings. It also included a single d6, d10, d12 and custom scatter die used for teleporting. In May 2011, a generous review of the game was offered in the Lost Game Safari column of the 'Knights of the Dinner Table' (issue 175) by Andy Miller.

137547.name: Emperor
137547.description:
Emperor is a climbing card game (in the mold of President, Tien Len, The Big Two, Tichu, The Great Dalmuti, etc.) that is playable with two regular card decks shuffled together. It was designed as a climbing game primarily for 6+ people (though rule variants permit 4-5 people to play as well).

The game allows singletons, sets (pairs, three of a kind, etc.), runs, and multi-runs (consecutive pairs, consecutive triples, etc.) as legal plays, which must then be followed by a play of that same type and of the same length, except in the case of special combinations known as "bombs." Several jokers are used as wild cards. Between rounds there is a unique redistribution phase in which all players discard a card face down; these are shuffled and dealt randomly back, one to each player.

Advanced rules allow for "calling a coup" in which one player names a calling card; the first person to play this calling card is the coup caller's partner. The coup succeeds if either player goes out first. A coup partnership receives a bonus or penalty depending on whether the coup succeeds or fails.

Other advanced rules allow for "class division" rounds in which face cards ("noble cards") cannot appear in combination with number cards ("commoner cards"), and in which there is "taxation" between rounds instead of redistribution (during taxation losers give winners their highest card). Further successful coups cause the game to toggle back and forth between such a class division round and the initial "class harmony" style of round, in which there are no restrictions on the play of face cards and there is "redistribution" between rounds.

137548.name: Poolaris
137548.description:
From the introduction:
Poolaris is a fantasy role-playing game that combines the negotiated narration and chilly setting of Ben Lehman's Polaris with the simple rules of James V. West's The Pool (and bits of James's The Questing Beast and Anti-Pool). Unlike most role-playing games, Poolaris has no Game Master (GM). The players share the GM responsibilities.

To play, you need a lot of six-sided dice (d6s), including a handful of “bonus dice” that look different from the rest. Before character creation, each player needs 20 dice for their starting Pool. The remaining dice go into a common pool.

137549.name: The Puddle
137549.description:
from the Inroduction:

The Puddle is a role-playing system designed to facilitate collaborative storytelling.

The Puddle does not have any rules for hit points, skills, character classes or levels; in fact it has very few rules at all.

Another key aspect of the game is that the ability of the players to influence events in the story is not limited solely to the actions of their characters. At times the players can actively guide the narrative and direct the story, essentially assuming the role of the GM.

137550.description:
It’s a card game for 3-to-8 players that combines storytelling and combat! It’s more about creativity and alluding to pop culture (or just regular culture) than it is about math or numbers. It takes about 30 minutes to play a full game, even with an 8 person game.

Players choose a Warrior card (like Medusa or Puss In Boots) from their hand to represent them in battle, then multiple players must work together as a team to defeat the players on the other side of the table. They also use Item cards (like Excalibur or Flying Carpet) to get them out of a tight spot and turn the battle around! Each battle is also set on a Battlefield (like Beanstalk or Sleepy Village) and players can use the terrain to their advantage.

The actual battle is conducted by players describing their character's action to the judge, who has final ruling on all matters. If it convinces the judge, it's fair game! After each battle, the role of the judge passes to the player on the current judge's left.
137550.name: Story War

137551.name: Baby Pals
137551.description:
The objective of the game is to take care of a virtual baby through certain tasks as feeding, bathing, and teaching just like a real father or mother would do. Players can choose the gender of the baby.

Source: Wikipedia, "Baby Pals", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137552.name: Shapik: The Quest
137552.description:
User summary

A short point and click adventure, where you aid Shapik through a forest of puzzles to find and free his sister.

137553.name: Diner Dash: Sizzle & Serve
137553.description:
Flo is a hard worker at a big stock market company in Dinertown. She's tired of doing all the work and feeling unfulfilled. Flo quits her job, wishing she could work someplace else. She spots a run down old diner, which she buys. Gameplay involves seating customers and guiding Flo around the restaurant to serve customers. If enough money is earned after each level, play progresses to the next. As the game progresses Flo updates the dilapidated restaurant she begins with and builds three further restaurants, which provide new settings.
Gameplay centers around catering to customers within a time limit to gather as much money as possible. Flo can be moved around the restaurant to complete tasks. As customers arrive in the restaurant, the player must drag and drop them onto a table, where they sit down and read menus. Then the player must guide Flo to the table to take their order, which must be taken to the service hatch. After the chef has prepared the meal, Flo must deliver the food. When the customers are finished eating they must be taken a check, at which point the customers leave a tip and their dishes on the table, departing the restaurant. The dishes must be cleared by Flo before the next set of customers can use the table. Each successful action earns the player points, performing the same action multiple times in a row earns the player a chain bonus, which is broken once a different action is performed.

Customers have a series of hearts over their heads that indicate their mood. The longer the customer is forced to wait, the more hearts he or she loses. Each type of customer has different degrees of patience and tipping habits. Flo can perform various actions, such as talking to customers or serving them drinks, to revive these hearts. When customers lose all their hearts, they leave the restaurant, costing the player points. The goal of a level is earn a certain number of points. There are also expert point totals for advanced players to achieve.
The game has two modes: Career mode, which follows the story of Flo, and Endless Shift, a survival mode in which the player must last as long as possible in a single level.
In the Cooking Dash variation, the player actually prepares the food as opposed to bringing the order to the chef for him to prepare it.

Source: Wikipedia, "Diner Dash", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137555.name: Jimmy the Greek Odds Maker Football
137555.description:
The game is based on American football and used cards to determine the outcome of plays. The plastic board represents an American Football field with a scoreboard, 10 yard marker, football, and has identical player charts on each side of the field. There is an Action deck of cards (52 in 4 suits) and two scrimmage decks (52 in 4 suits each). The suits represent different offensive and defensive play options, long pass (heart), short pass (diamond), running play (spade), or line play (club). The Action deck is used for non-scrimmage and special plays. Each player uses one of the scrimmage decks for plays from scrimmage. The scrimmage decks have a number 2-14 inclusive and a suit on the front. The back also has the suit. This allows the player to decide what type of play to run from the back of the cards without knowing how strong the play will be.

For an example of a scrimmage play, assume the offensive player looks at the back of his deck and chooses long pass (heart). The defensive player chooses running defense (spade). Both players turn over their cards and show 10 of heart and 7 of spade for a +3. Cross reference +3 and spade on the long pass chart to see that this is a 16 yard gain.

There are also rules for field goals, interceptions, fumbles, penalties and options, fair catch, on-side kick, etc.

The Odds Maker wheel is used to handicap the people playing the game and uses the number of times they have played this game, age, did they play football, do they like football, and do they follow football.

137557.name: Onderweg!
137557.description:
Toddlers put their first steps in strategic and logical thinking with this game.

They have to find the way home from the the playground as soon as possible, but of course there must first be fulfilled orders on the way...

In the game are 2 games included: The rescue & Shopping

In 'The rescue' is a lot of misery on the go! Debris on the track, a hole in the ground, a big dangerous dog on the street,.. Defeating all problems first as quickly as possible and reach your house.

'Shopping' helps your strategic thinking ahead to retrieve all your messages. Put your arrow cards as good as possible and get try to complete your shopping list first!

Each game further consists of 2 versions. You can choose to play with or against each other. Play together, it becomes a race against time. A cooperative game for the little ones ...

137558.name: Wie Wat Waar?
137558.description:
The game board is a house that is puzzled together. All things have to be sorted in the right room. In three games, the game expanded vocabulary and teach children to play together.

The game board consists of a colorful puzzle with a turntable in the middle. In total there are 6 rooms and each room has a different color. The game includes small slices with objects. On these disks are pictures of objects. These objects belong each to one specific room of the house. This can be checked at the back of the disk: Ex. the kitchen is shown as red and all disks that belong in the kitchen have a red back.

In the game, the vocabulary around the house is practiced in different games. One game it is cooperative: The players then play against the slob. Does the turntable in the attic? Then you can slob a place ahead. Does the arrow shows to another room? Then all the players together look at an object out of this room. When they indicate a correct disc, they can put it away.

Are all discs put away before the slob is on the last box? Then you all won the game!

137559.description:
As the war continues endlessly, many new weapons roll off the factory floors of the Warship Guild!

The Gunship Mk II doesn’t have the classic lines of her predecessor, but she packs a powerful punch! Dual Torpedo Launchers and two Multi-Purpose Weapon Pods give the Mk II a wide variety of explosive ordnance to crack open an enemy Assault Carrier or mercilessly hammer their positions on the ground below.

This accessory for Gunship: First Strike! gives Players access to a new Gunship option. The Mk II looks, customizes, and fights in ways that are different from the standard Gunship included in the core game. When you’re ready for a new experience, the Gunship Mk II makes a great addition to your fleet!
137559.name: Gunship: Mk II

137560.name: Songo ewondo
137560.description:
Songo Ewondo, often just called Songo, is played by the Ekang (also known as "Fang" or "Pangwe") in Cameroon, Equatorial Guinea, Gabon and the northwest corner of the D. R. of the Congo. It is one of the most popular mancala games.

Songo is known for its rich orature of funny stories, which were recorded by the German anthropologist Günter Tessmann (1884 - 1969) in 1907. The game is a popular mindsport in Africa. Songo competitions are held every weekend in Douala, Cameroon.

The game is promoted by the minister for culture and art and the president of the Republic of Gabon, Mr Omar Bongo Ondimba. There are plans to teach Songo at all the schools of the country. Over 200 Songo masters (called "nti") attend every year a huge tournament in Libreville.

The Songo World Championship in the village of Oyop (South Cameroon) attracts famous players from many countries. The current world champion is the Gabonese Vivi Metou. Other strong players are Endelé, Lévy Megne-Masseko, Narcisse Nguema, Davy Obiang, Ta-Ndong, Moulouma, Kamsi, Romy Nguema, Zuè Allogo, and Desiré Meba Mefame.

Rules

Songo is played on a mancala board ("mbek") of 2 x 7 holes. These holes are called "nda" ("house"). At each end there is a big store for the captured counters. Each house contains five stones called "songo" ("pebble"). A player controls the row on his side of the board.

On his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes, one by one, clockwise into the ensuing houses. The leftmost hole of a row may only be emptied, if if contains at least three stones unless it would be the only possible move. However, the hole may be emptied, if the move results in a capture or if the opponent has (a) nothing left in his holes and (b) it isn't possible to feed him with three or more stones.

If a hole contained 14 or more stones, it is skipped and all the player's own holes that follow. The remaining stones are only sown on the opponent's side. If the opponent has no stones left, he must be fed with at least seven stones. If this can't be done, he must get as many stones as possible.

A player must move at his turn. If the last stone falls in an opponent's hole, which contained one, two or three stones, its contents are captured together with the last stone (ie. two, three or four stones). If the previous-to-last stone also brought an opponent's house to two, three or four, these are captured as well, and so on. If 14, 21 or 28 stones were sown, only the last stone can be captured, but nothing else.

When a player has only one stone left in his row and this stone is in his leftmost hole, he captures it. If a move would captures all all an opponent's seeds, the capture is forfeited, and the seeds are instead left on the board. The game ends when a player cannot move. The stones that are still on the board are won by the player who moved last.

The player who captured most counters wins. If both players captured the same number, the game is a draw.

137561.name: Mummy: the Curse

rpghonor.27220: 2014 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Nominee

137561.description:
From the Kickstarter page:

Imagine being both dead and deathless at the same time. Imagine being cradled in the arms of death for years, sometimes decades on end, but all the while knowing that you will eventually not only arise again, but awaken to an unfamiliar world that mostly fears and hates you. Now imagine that your purpose, your entire existence, is bound within this cycle -- that you are chained to it for all eternity. You sleep, you wake, your serve your Judge's will in the lands of the living, and you return to the death-sleep once more. The ancient culture that empowered you is gone, lost to the sands of time... yet you endure.

In Mummy: The Curse, a Storytelling game set in the World of Darkness, you play one of these beings. Those who know they exist, from the cultists who serve them to the dark forces arrayed against them, call them the Deathless.

We call them mummies.

137562.name: Nr 1:2056
137562.description:
user summary

First issue of generally acclaimed idea of a ezine.

137563.name: Town of Alliancia
137563.description:
From publisher blurb:

Exciting town for your fantasy campaign!

Have towns and encounters in your game become repetitious, stale and full of dull bedlam? Are you looking for items that have fresh personalities of their own? Look no further, Scaldcrow Generic offers new perspectives on old RPG staples.

Scaldcrow Generic works with any game system, offering you rich variety for an economical budget. Our products are designed to be fast and easy to use. Our generic products are also easily adaptable to any system. Use this book as it stands, add information or make changes. Scaldcrow Generic empowers you to enhance your campaign any way you like.

Fully detailed town and map
Over 65 NPCs in for both generic and Dark Fantasy of Sundrah
Succinct political statistics on nearby human and goblin fortresses as well as statistics on the legendary city-state of Earthmere
Original businesses and criminal syndicates
Mercenary bands, a secret witch coven and knightly orders
Quick, easy to follow character descriptions
Optional skill system for generic use
New game synergy allows you to connect dungeons from other game systems neatly into the Alliancia storyline.
Everything you need to add this incredible location to your campaign world

137564.name: Het Geheugenspel
137564.description:
Who is able to memorize everything and all actions within the time? Who will collect the most cards at the end of the game? Who can remember crazy words and perform actions and sounds? The Memory Game is a hilarious card game where both children and adults against each recording. Hilarity is guaranteed!

This card game contains 3 types of cards: nonsense words, actions and sounds. A player takes one card from each pile and get thirty seconds to get it all in his minds. Then it is the turn of the opponents: They get 30 seconds to distract the player. Can player 1 say the nonsense word, imitate the action and the sound?

137565.name: Roadhouse: NPC Companion
137565.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need to find a hero or ally to slay a dragon? Fight an army? Defeat the cruel overlord?

The Golden Gauntlet roadhouse is a haven for mercenaries, adventurers and rogues that should fit the bill. So if you need to flesh out your fantasy party, the Roadhouse should be your first stop.

This book contains:

20 fully detailed fantasy characters
Over 30 background characters
Roadhouse service, menu, price guide, etc
Brief description of the owners and the Gypsy staff of the roadhouse
Map to the Golden Gauntlet tavern floor
Value Assignment Table help you to quickly compare the relative skills of the characters for use in your campaign
Bonus! Rules for 3-Sweep, an original fun and deceptively brutal gambling card game. Make your own Swoop deck from any standard deck of cards.




Get to the Roadhouse now! There is always one more room, reserved for you.

137566.name: DragonFall
137566.description:
From publisher blurb:

Transform your campaign world into a DragonFall campaign!
Use this book as a generic guideline for your system.

You can Play as dragon-kind or as a dragon fighter. Roleplay in a world torn between dragons, man, andthe gods. Make your stand with dragons or oppose their rule. Your players will have the options of exciting, new races, professions, and magical spells.

Harness the power of Dragonballs and Flaming Pearls and change the world forever. By uniting these fabled objects, you can empower a dragon, or create a god!

Play an Abandi, a naga-like race foresaken by the dragon world
Play as a Dragao, a race of dragon people
Harness the awesome elemental power of dragons by wielding Dragon Emblems. Each emblem emparting special abilities and bonuses, whether you are tapping into the power of a fire dragon or the frightning power of a death dragon.
Play a dracomancer!
Play a dragon slayer!
Play a Draktyl rider!
PLay as a Wu-Xia!
Play as a Warrior Priest!
Battle dragons or gods! Find Dragonballs and flaming pearls and use them to create or destroy city gods.
9 Dragon encounters detailed, including: Dragon Kings, Dragon Maids, Dragon Wolves, Draktyl, Naga, Pocket Dragons.
A simple comparitive chart helps to easily incorporate dragonfall characters and plot into your game.




Play using the rules for Bare Bones Multiverse, or simply use this book as a generic guideline and adapt your current system.

137567.name: Het Nieuwe Grote Basisschoolspel vragenset 1ste leerjaar
137567.description:
This adds new questions to the base game, especially for children in the 1 year of Belgium's 'basisschool'.

Not playable without the base game!

137568.name: Kingdoms of Legend: Haunted Woods
137568.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Ghost Story with Wolves!
The Kingdoms of Legend: Encounters line of PDFs present a single well-built encounter for a GM to drop into any campaign. Each installment uses a specific location and offers three encounters at that site at three different challenge ratings.

We do all of the detail work behind the scenes to generate the stats, calculate the CR, choose the treasure, etc: all of the stuff that can seem like the ‘doing your taxes' side of GM-ing. All you have to do is roll some dice and have some fun!

In this episode, the number of wolf sightings has increased dramatically around the village of Devin. Now people say the woods are haunted! Something strange is going on, and the PCs are asked to deal with the situation.

137569.name: Kingdoms of Legend: Nest of Dragons
137569.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dragons Stalk the Forest!
The Kingdoms of Legend: Encounters line of PDFs present a single well-built encounter for a GM to drop into any campaign. Each installment uses a specific location and offers three encounters at that site at three different challenge ratings.

We do all of the detail work behind the scenes to generate the stats, calculate the CR, choose the treasure, etc: all of the stuff that can seem like the ‘doing your taxes' side of GM-ing. All you have to do is roll some dice and have some fun!

In this episode, a group of green dragons has taken over the site of an old copper mine and stone quarry. Livestock, woodcutters, and miners have all gone missing recently and much of the forest wildlife has fled the area. The village needs brave heroes to deal with this dire threat soon, before it's too late!

137570.name: Kingdoms of Legend: Ninja Attack!
137570.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Ninja Attack!
The Kingdoms of Legend: Adventures line of PDFs present a single 4-hour night of roleplaying action. Suitable for use at a game convention or as a one shot adventure, these products come complete with 6 pre-made player characters.

In this episode, a powerful Silk Road merchant has hired the services of the deadly ninja of the Hasu Clan. He wishes his most treacherous rival eliminated, once and for all. The PCs take on the roles of the ninja strike team to infiltrate the lavish desert estate and complete the bloody task.

An adventure module for six 10th level ninja (characters provided!).

137571.name: Quartaal
137571.description:
Do you learn the Dutch language? Spelling has no secrets for you anymore? Whether you are a player who just have to have the tactical moves? 'Quartaal' is a tactical language game.

'Quartaal' is a language game that can be played on multiple levels. On every question card are questions from different levels (level 2nd to 6th grade). Players get at the beginning of the game one or more game cards, depending on the number of game boards that they play. It can be played with 1 game board for the first time, making the game easier, but it can be extended to 4 game boards.

Players try to complete their tasks as well as possible to earn points. They answer every 'language-question' which is asked by another player and earn blocks. These blocks must be placed on a game board. It is important to play tactically, score many points and make opponents to lose points.

The system is very well organized. By using multiple game boards, the game becomes harder and more tactical. Unfortunately, there are few (60) double-sided question cards for the second through the sixth grade. Although they are printed on both sides, but it still gives only 120 orders per year.

137572.name: Kingdoms of Legend: Timekeeping
137572.description:
From publisher blurb:

Track the Turning Seasons!

This 20-page PDF is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible supplement for the Kingdoms of Legend campaign setting. It is an overview of how hours, days, and months are recorded in the setting, containing descriptions of a number of important religious festivals, a comprehensive table of the gods in the pantheon, and an illuminated calendar.

137573.name: Kingdoms of Legend: Watchtower at Kaldehjem
137573.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Cold Wind Blowing
The Kingdoms of Legend: Adventures line of PDFs present a single 4-hour night of roleplaying action. Suitable for use at a game convention or as a one shot adventure, these products come complete with 6 pre-made player characters.

In this episode, we journey to the frozen mountains of the Cold North! The heroes are asked to brave the elements and find out what happened to the inhabitants of a remote dwarven watchtower.

Will the steely resolve and gritty determination of the adventuring band be enough to win the day?

An adventure module for six 12th level heroes (characters provided!).

137574.name: Kingdoms of Legend: Ultimate Treasure Fleet
137574.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold the Raft of Stars!

This free PDF discusses the Chinese admiral and explorer Zheng He (pronounced jung huh) and his massive treasure fleet's effect on the western Europe of the Kingdoms of Legend campaign setting.

Included are a few new ship stats for the enormous junks in the armada and a few new gunpowder based explosive devices. This PDF is a companion of sorts to the book Kingdoms of Legend: All Hands on Deck!

This edition is an updated version of Treasure Fleet of Zheng He to include the new stat block formats as found in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Combat book.

137575.name: Fieldrunners 2
137575.description:
User Summary

Fieldrunners 2 is the latest entry in the Fieldrunners series of tower defense games. As before the goal is to stop the "runners" an army of infantry, vehicles, and flyers from reaching their goal by building a variety of towers to stop them. A new feature is traps and items which can be used to attack on your command.

The sequel boasts many new levels, new towers, and a 20 hour campaign. Each stage has several modes to play in.

137576.name: Farwest
137576.description:
Welcome to the FarWest!

In this game each player will assume the role of a Deputy and they will try to help the Sheriff to deal with all of the Farwest troubles.
The Sheriff, qill be moved by one of the players around the city, and its surroundings. Each player will colect Rumors (cards in hand) so they can make a row of Suspects (cards in game) for each complete Row of suspects (5 cards) the players will try to score as many points they can.

With a scoring similar to Poker, players will have to combine the different Rumors into actual suspects and deliver them to the Sheriff, or use them to get rid of the Big Bad Guys that will arrive in the city.

Players will have to place their Deputy (player token) in one of the places in the board (city, surroundings, and far away) and execute the action that it allows them to do. At the end of the turn (every player have done his action) players are allowed to place rumors into play (to become suspects) accordling to the place and action he chooses.

Each time 2 or more Deputys chooses the same place they will have to duel for the action.

To impress the Sheriff and the Farwest Community, the Deputy must not achieve the lowest score in any of the solved problems.

To help the deputy in his duty, there will be special people (special cards) that can lend a hand in fighting the crime!

When the 3rd Big Bad Ugly Guy is eliminated the game is over, and the Sheriff will nominate only one sucessor!

Good luck!

137577.name: Pure Steam Campaign Setting Beta Playtest
137577.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the age of steam, coal is king.

Pure Steam is a steampunk campaign setting compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This isn’t your grandma’s steampunk. Hillbillies and Yankees scatter the landscape, which is more Appalachian than Victorian. The old, tired mountains rich in coal veins are home to the economic powerhouses of the setting.

This book focuses on the Federated States of Ullera, a relatively young nation born out of the Abolition War, founded on freedom from oppression and learning to cope with newfound economic prosperity.

Plunge into the setting with original subraces, each fresh and exciting.
Test out the Chaplain, an original base class able to heal and buff without magic. Representing her chosen association (each of which grants unique powers and options), she adventures for the betterment of society.
Try your hand at one of eight unique archetypes.
Aim true with new weapons, accessories, and gadgetry.
Kick the tires. Brand new vehicles await for rapid travel and exciting combat.
Experience the horror science can awaken with new monsters.

137578.name: Talisman Prologue
137578.description:
The superb fantasy adventure board game that is ‘Talisman’ makes it into the domain of the video game. The first release is called Talisman Prologue - a version based on the full-rule set that is designed to let solo players quickly explore the nature of each character and the board itself in a series of challenging quests.

Source: The Game Website.

137579.name: Tephra Steampunk Roleplaying Game Playing Guide
137579.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tephra: the Steampunk RPG needs only a single book to be played: your Playing Guide. This 288 page, hardcover book is gorgeous, with the award-winning Clockwork Roleplaying System and a ton of lore and art that makes Tephra a fan-favorite setting. The Playing Guide contains everything you need to start playing in your own world of steampowered robots, top hats, and proper manners!

137581.name: A Radiance Faded

rpgseries.39622: CORE - Living Forgotten Realms Core Adventures

137581.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Many fear that a Thayan plague is killing livestock in Thesk as a precursor to a full-scale invasion. The true cause may be much simpler but much more deadly. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Thesk and Rashemen for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). This adventure is an epilogue to the Radiance Against Thay series, which included CORE1-2 Radiant Vessel of Thesk, CORE1-6 Incident at the Gorge of Gauros, and CORE1-14 What Storms May Come.

137582.name: Antichamber

videogamehonor.32068: 2012 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee

137582.description:
User Summary

Antichamber is a first person exploration game where you will encounter various challenges and puzzles and need to solve them in creative ways. The player will encounter a gun that can manipulate matter which they will need to succeed.

137583.name: TKKG Tätersuche
137583.description:
A license game about the childrens crime book series TKKG (Tim Karl Kloesschen Gabi, the 4 detectives including the dog...).

Someone spraypainted the neighbours wall. But who was it? The players (detectives) have to choose between 8 suspects that wear different coloured clothing. The culprit is determined by three upside down chips that depict the guilty ones cap, shoes etc. A player gets to see these chips by rolling three dice one to three times. When two dice show the same colour a card is drawn and the player has to do the action written on the card or give a correct answer to the question on the card. After one player has seen all three chips the game ends. The players guess which of the 8 suspects has done it. The player guessing correctly wins.

137584.name: Bibi Blocksberg: Das geheimnisvolle Schloss
137584.description:
The mysterious witch Schlos Salt Mania has now come up with a very special job for Bibi and her young witches-girlfriends. The aim is to climb the highest tower of the castle!
But beware there are many obstacles on the way - the ground under their feet may open up or a bewitched tree catapult them at the start.

The first player who reaches to the highest tower first is the winner.

137585.name: Legend of Wukong
137585.description:
User Summary

The Legend of Wukong was originally a China-only Mega Drive game that has recently (2008) been released for the Genesis. It is a Roleplaying game loosely based on the Chinese tale, Journey to the West. It features the trials of a young boy lost in ancient China, who must retrieve the time machine that brought him there and return to 1996.

137587.name: Living Liquids: Tephra Alchemy Expansion
137587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alchemists have learned to brew life into their vials, bringing you a new craft known as Living Liquids. With living liquids, you can bring vicious viscous creatures to the battlefield that will fight, electrocute, and grapple your enemies. You'll be able to morph living liquids into weapons, use them as firearm ammunition, or cover your body in liquid armor. This PDF is an expansion to Tephra: the Steampunk RPG. It includes 16 specialties and 31 augments unlike anything you've seen before.

137588.name: 3-Guns & the Big Steal
137588.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers arrive in town just in time to stop a robbery-in-progress, as 3-Guns Charlie and his gang are busting into the Trust Bank. This is a simple adventure designed to introduce new players to Tephra: the Steampunk RPG.

The adventure PDF includes several fights and maps that you can print from home.

137589.name: The Airship Graveyard
137589.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Airship Graveyard is full of retired and gutted dirigibles, airships, and ironbirds... but that's what everyone expected to find there. The bio-mutated mercenaries, enormous electrified snake, and mad scientist who's moved into the junkyard: well, they were a little bit more of a surprise.

This is a straight-forward adventure for first level adventurers for Tephra: the Steampunk RPG.

137590.name: The Armsmith Extra: Munition, Shield & Turret Crafting
137590.description:
From publisher blurb:

TArmsmith might have been awesome before, but why don't we just make it a little more awesome... by introducing Munition crafting, shield forging, and turret building! Filled with 16 specialties and 57 augments, this is sure to become a mainstay for your party's crafter... and, unfortunately, for your enemy's crafter as well!

boardgamecompilation.6089: The 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games

137591.description:
Equipment
One game sheet (reproduced on graph paper or photocopied), consisting of an upper and a lower field, and a pencil for each player.
Object
The aim is to be the first to deduce the opponent’s secret network of lines by systematically ‘spying’ on the opponent’s upper field.

Make two copies of the game sheet on graph paper (or by photocopying), and give one copy to each player. In the upper field of his game sheet, each player lays out a network (without letting his opponent see it) consisting of six lines - each of a different length, ranging from one to six grid unit lengths, inclusive. The lines must be drawn either horizontally or vertically, must be connected together (in any order), and must turn at right angles at each connection point. The lines may not touch each other except to where one ends and another starts. Illustrations 1 and 2 show networks that tin have been laid out correctly. Illustration 3 shows an incorrectly drawn network. (See images for the examples.

Play
1. One player spies by asking the opponent about the contents of a space in the opponent’s field (such as
1A, 2B and so on). If there is a line - or two connecting lines - in that space, the opponent announces: ‘hot’.
If there is no line in that space, but it is adjacent to a space containing a line, the opponent announces: ‘warm’. Squares which touch diagonally are not considered adjacent for this purpose. In all other cases, the opponent announces‘cold’. The opponent then asks about the contents of a space and the first player replies, thereby completing a round.
2. Each player uses the lower field on his game sheet for keeping track of information he obtains by spying.
3. In any round a player may, instead of spying on a single space, spy on from two to five connected spaces belonging to a single horizontal or vertical row. Whenever a player makes use of multiple spying, he must cross out below his upper field a square containing a number equal to the number of squares spied upon that turn. A player whose six numbered squares have all been crossed out may no longer use multiple spying, and the
opponent should keep track of this by using the squares under his own lower field.

At the end of any round either or both players may try to reconstruct their opponent’s network. A correct reconstruction counts as a single victory for the player. An incorrect reconstruction counts as a double victory for the opponent. (Thus it is possible for a tie to occur or for one player to win as much as a triple victory.) A player , who has made an incorrect secret construction or given the opponent incorrect information, automatically loses.

If the horizontal two-unit line in Illustration 1 were moved one grid unit to the right and connected with the four-unit line rather than the one-unit line, identical information would be obtained from spying. In such a case, either reconstruction would be considered correct.

Variation
Advanced players may agree to use more lines. Even the addition of an extra one-unit line greatly increases the strategic complexity.
137591.name: Spy!

boardgamefamily.9638: Sid Sackson pencil and paper collections

137592.name: You've Been Sentenced! Country Music Edition
137592.description:
Additional 80 cards for the game You've Been Sentenced! with Country music theme.

This sentence-building game uses unique five-sided cards with multiple conjugations of a base word. With a hand of 10 cards, players try to score the most points per round by constructing the longest, grammatically correct, and sensible sentence. Each card used in a sentence is worth 5 points, but using some of the more difficult conjugations on the card can earn you bonus points. Any player can object to another players sentence, on either grammatical grounds, or the fact that the sentence just doesn’t make sense. The defending player and the objecting player get to argue their points to the rest of the players, who form a jury. The jury gets to vote on whether or not the sentence is acceptable. Half the fun is trying to defend, explain, and justify a completely ridiculous sentence to the other players. Accepted sentences score points, rejected sentences get you zip. First player to reach 200 points wins.

137593.name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Brain Buster Word Challenge
137593.description:
Get your word on with the You've Been Sentenced Brain Buster Deck that will challenge even the most proficient linguists!

This sentence-building game uses unique five-sided cards with multiple conjugations of a base word. With a hand of 10 cards, players try to score the most points per round by constructing the longest, grammatically correct, and sensible sentence. Each card used in a sentence is worth 5 points, but using some of the more difficult conjugations on the card can earn you bonus points. Any player can object to another players sentence, on either grammatical grounds, or the fact that the sentence just doesn’t make sense. The defending player and the objecting player get to argue their points to the rest of the players, who form a jury. The jury gets to vote on whether or not the sentence is acceptable. Half the fun is trying to defend, explain, and justify a completely ridiculous sentence to the other players. Accepted sentences score points, rejected sentences get you zip. First player to reach 200 points wins.

137594.description:
In Die Siedler von Catan: Das Mini-Spiel, players try to be the dominant force on the island of Catan by building settlements, cities, and roads. On each turn dice are rolled to determine what resources the island produces. Players collect these resources to build up their civilizations to get to 7 victory points and win the game.

Probably a promotional giveaway similar to the Keltis Mini-Spiel (same box size). Basically it's a stripped down 3 player-only version of the "Travel" edition. There are no development cards, no "longest road" or "most knights" bonus points; resource hexes, resource die roll numbers and player starting positions are pre-determined. Otherwise mostly standard Catan rules apply, first player to reach 7 VP wins.
137594.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Mini-Spiel

137596.description: A new edition of the party word association game "Der HeidelBÄR" from Heidelberger Spieleverlag. "Der HeidelBÄR" is a party game where everybody uses word association to describe a word with a per, peer, bear in it. The word is replaced with a bear and you need to describe it for the others with only six words. but the first two words are always "This bear..." or "My bear...". So you actually only have four words and you are not allowed to use words which are in the word you have to guess. In this version words are used of which parts sound like the names of animals of the forest.
137596.name: Der HeidelBÄR: Wald und Wiesen Edition

137597.name: SOS
137597.description:
Will the ship sink or not?
Perhaps the ship dwarf can help

S.O.S. Is a exciting game because you need skill and a little bit of luck.
A game with real water! But no fear: a large receptacle ensures that everything stays within the limit.
And if you spill some water, don't worry, there is a piece of cloth to wipe it away.

Purpose of the game:
It comes down to skill: Who drops water so convenient and carefully in the sailboat, that ship does not sink?
The goal is not to sink the ship, so you have the least you knots in your rope.

The player whose turn it is, throw the dice and then pour the water from the bowl into the floating boat as the number of eyes that he has thrown . So up to three shoots or better yet droplets.

It is important that for each point you rolled on the dice, you have start again to pour the water from the bowl into the floating boat. More drops from a single pouring count as one!

Is the player skillful, and the boat sinks not during his turn, then the next player must show his agility. Also, he should throw the dice and then pour the water into the boat.

Sinks the boat, then the player whose turn it is, must lay a knot in his rope.
Then he makes the sailboat empty and turn it back on the water. This player begins the next round.

The game ends when a player have three knots in his rope.
The player with the fewest knots in his rope, is the winner.

137598.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 3 - Winter 2013)
137598.description:
Frontier Explorer
Issue #3
...wondering how we work
Winter 2013
Cover art by Ali Ries

137600.name: Alien Invaders
137600.description:
From the Back of the Book:

When a horrifying swarm of insectlike aliens called Cephids is discovered speeding through space, the Space Hawks are called to action. Destroying everything in their path, the Cepids are heading to the planet Baakra--and then Earth!

It's a challenge only the space Hawks can meet. Together you fly into the jaws of death, outwit the mysterious Cephids, and save the galaxy from destruction.

137601.name: Crusher Castle II
137601.description:
User Summary

Crusher Castle II is the sequel to Crusher. It features similar gameplay to the original, except that it has been re-themed to that of a haunted castle that is filled with ghosts and requires candles in place of the square monsters and the oxygen requirement of the previous game. There are no unmovable boxes and the rooms are larger, though the 5x5 grid still exists.
The player must accumulate 10,000 points before pursuing the objectives, which include finding characters and items spread throughout the castle.

137602.name: Cyberdogs
137602.description:
User Summary

Cyberdogs is a top down, 2D shooter for one or two players. One unique aspect in this game, particularly for this time, is that the fog of war conceals whatever is behind an object. The map is invaluable because of this added navigational hindrance.
As a mercenary, the player takes on missions that have particular goals: collect an item, kill a certain individual or number of enemies and so on. Upgrades can be purchased between levels.

137603.name: The Waterloo Game
137603.description:
"Why did Wellington win?"

This is an abstract challenge for one or two players. The board is a "T" shaped pattern of 33 squares in alternating colors. Each square is marked with the name of a Napoleonic battle. There are 32 playing pieces (like checkers) in two colors. The playing pieces are placed on the board, leaving the center "Waterloo" square empty. The object of the game is to "jump" every piece, leaving just one token left and positioned in the center space. In the two player version the contestants take turns making their jumps.

Includes the 16" x 16" board and 32 tokens. The rules are printed inside the box.

137604.name: Cybersphere
137604.description:
User Summary

Cybersphere is a paddle game of the Breakout vein, featuring an array of blocks that must be hit with a ball that bounces back and forth between the targets and the paddle.
Numerous power ups and point bonuses exist throughout the varied levels, which may include invisible blocks, angled walls, and other surprises.

137606.name: Ask Anything
137606.description:
It's a party game about communication and realize the true thoughts of your friends!

Everyone has two chances to ask a Yes/No question,each other players must secretly(face down) play a Yes(or No) card as answer , then everyone including the asking player, tries to bet "There are how many YES among the answers", shuffle all answer cards and reveal them, you earn 1 point if your bet is correct!

Note! if all the answers are YES or NO, this means the question is not interesting, the asking player won't earn any point this turn; the other players all earn 1 point no matter their bet are correct or not.

137608.name: The Opera Game
137608.description:
There are 3 ways to play.

Game Type 1
The first involves dealing out cards face down. The remaining deck is placed faced down. The first player draws a card. Cards are drafted by each player. There is a 5 card maximum hand limit. You may discard cards and other players may draft the discarded cards. You are trying to collect the sets of performers to perform your famous opera.

Game Type 2
Same as first game but the completed operas are scored and better operas will score more than more minor operas. The game is played to a score of 40 with operas scoring from 12 to 18 points.

Game Type 3 is the expert game

To score bonus turns you must answer trivia question correctly about the operas in the game.

Photography: Ron Scherl
Opera questions: Kenn Harris

137609.description:
More from the ultimate Pop trivia card game with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify!

Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.

May be played with [game id=93736] or separately
137609.name: More Pop The Question

137610.description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.
137610.name: More Pop the Question Extra

137611.description:
The ultimate Pop trivia card game enters the world of Rock, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify!

The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.
137611.name: Pop The Question: Rock

137612.description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your rock card collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.
137612.name: Pop the Question: Rock Extra

137613.description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your 50s & 60s collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.
137613.name: Pop The Question: 50s And 60s extra

137614.description: An extra addition to the Pop the Question series – 52 more cards to add to your Soul, Funk and Hip Hop card collection! The ultimate Pop trivia card game, with a host of new artists and bands for you to identify! Guess the identity of the artist or band from the clues on the cards. The first player to guess wins that card and whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner.
137614.name: Pop the Question: Soul, Funk And Hip Hop Extra

127330.name: Pop The Question: Soul, Funk and Hip-Hop

137616.name: 90's Music Trivia
137616.description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1990’s style Hi-Fi, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of music. Includes questions from artists such as Spice Girls, Tupac Shakur, Bryan Adams, Oasis, Aerosmith, Britney Spears,Vanilla Ice, The Fugees, Will Smith and many more!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137617.name: 80's Music Trivia
137617.description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1980’s style boom box, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of music. Includes questions from artists such as Michael Jackson, Queen, Run DMC, Bon Jovi, Madonna, Elton Johm, Prince, Bruce Springsteen, Iron Maiden and many more!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137618.name: 90's TV Trivia
137618.description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1990's style TV, this retro quiz will take you back to the greatest days of television, featuring classics such as The Simpsons, Sex and The City, and Friends.

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137619.name: 80's TV Trivia
137619.description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1980’s style TV, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of television, featuring classics such as The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Quantum Leap, and The A-Team.

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137620.name: 70's TV Trivia
137620.description:
