Presented in a mini collectable 1970’s style TV, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of television. Featuring classics such as M.A.S.H., The Dukes of Hazard, Happy Days, Dallas, Charlie's Angels, Battlestar Galactica, Are You Being Served, Sesame Street, Kojak, Monty Python and many more!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137621.name: Movie Trivia Cards

boardgamefamily.21532: Spinning Hat Music and TV Trivias

137621.description:
So you reckon you're the ultimate movie buff? Well get your film fanatic friends round and battle it out with our Retro Movie Trivia Game. Covering all the classics from Indiana Jones to Bridget Jones.

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137622.name: Awesome 80's Trivia Game
137622.description:
Pull on your leg warmers, back comb your hair and get ready to test your knowledge of the outrageous decade we all secretly love, with Spinning Hat's set of 80's Trivia Cards! Test your friends on topics such as the music, fashion, films and TV of the most talked about decade!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137623.name: 70's Music Trivia
137623.description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1970’s style Vinyl Deck, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of music. Includes questions from artists such as Led Zepplin, Stevie Wonder, ABBA, Fleetwood Mac, Bob Marley, Jackson 5, Earth, Wind and Fire, David Bowie, James Brown and more!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

137624.name: Rollo
137624.description:
Objective: Gain as many points as possible hitting slots
- acting by turns -
With use of a roller rail each player tries to lead his/her rolling cisc into a slot (scoring due to printed value);
the broader the angle the smaller the slot the higher the score...
remarks:
should be published during 1920's

137626.description: The road to Cheren is our new game covering the Eritrea campaign in East Africa in 1941. The campaign featured British and French forces versus the Italians in a wild and mountainous country. Cheren is a game where the movement of each piece is critical. After movement your opponent may react but with only a few units, making player decisions difficult; do I go to the aid of a unit likely to be attacked or use my reaction to push troops forward in an area where I am on the offensive. After combat there is exploitation movement. Only motorized infantry, tanks and cavalry may exploit and are scarce in this campaign. In addition there is a very nice chit pull system to give both sides some special abilities and keep the enemy guessing as to what comes next. Finally some Italian native units may decide to join the Allies, or they may stay loyal, which creates extra tension in the game
137626.name: The Road to Cheren

137627.name: Prosterno
137627.description:
Prosterno is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in March 2010. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. The pawn under attack must jump horizontally or vertically over an empty square to the next square of the same color behind it and when it is not possible it is taken off the board.

The goal of the game is to reach the opponent's side of the board or to eliminate all the opponent's pawns.
Each player has 9 pawns at the beginning of the match
The capturing is obligatory
1. The pawns can move only diagonally, one square at a time in four directions.
2. When two or more opposing pawns are in adjacent squares, then:
a. The pawn under attack must jump horizontally or
vertically over an empty square to the next
square of the same colour behind it, but should
remain on the same straight line as the
attacking pawn.
b. If the pawn cannot escape to the second square
(because it is already occupied or if it is at the edge of
the board), it is taken off the board.
c. If the escape brings the escaping pawn into contact
with an opponent’s pawn, it must attack it in
the same move.

137628.name: Basileus
137628.description:
Basileus is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in November 2010. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. A king (called basileus) making a capturing move must leap over one or several of the opponent's chessmen but cannot jump over the opponent's king.

The goal of the game is to eliminate the king (basileus) from the board.
Each player has 4 pawns, 4 pieces and a king at the beginning of the game
The capturing is obligatory

1. A chessman making a non-capturing move (not involving a jump) may move only one square in all allowed directions.
2. A chessman making a capturing move (a jump) leaps over one of the opponent's chessman. Only one chessman may be captured in a single jump; however, when possible the player must perform multiple jumps in one move in all allowed directions.
Pawns
1. The pawns can only move diagonally, one square at a time.
2. The pawns capture the opposing chessman by jumping over it to the nearest square of the same colour. To do this they can move to the left or to the right, forwards or backwards, but not diagonally.
3. Pawns can only move on squares of one colour, so if they start on a white square they must always stay on white squares.
4. Pawns may only capture the Basileus or other pawns, they may not capture other pieces.
5. The game ends when one player captures the opponent’s Basileus by jumping over it to the next empty square.
Pieces
1. The pieces can only move diagonally, one square at a time.
2. The pieces capture opposing chessman by jumping over it to the nearest square of the same colour, diagonally in four directions, not to the left or to the right, forwards or backwards, Pieces can only move on squares of one colour, so if they start on a black square they must always stay on black squares.
3. Pieces may only capture the opponent’s pawns or Basileus, they may not capture other pieces.
4. The game ends when one player captures the opponent’s Basileus by jumping over it to the next empty square.

Basileus
1. The Basileus can move one square at a time in all directions, also diagonally.
2. The Basileus can capture opposing chessman by jumping over it to the nearest square of the same colour. To do this they can move to the left or to the right, forwards or backwards, or diagonally.
3. The Basileus cannot jump over the opponent’s Basileus, so if it finally stops on a square next to the opponent’s Basileus, the opponent can replace it with his own Basileus, thus winning the game.

137629.name: Nubulus
137629.description:
Nubulus is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in Sepember 2011. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. It is a transformation of checkers with the difference that the pawns move forwards, right or left, but they capture diagonally.

The goal of the game is to reach the opponent's side of the board or to eliminate all the opponent's pawns.
Each player has 14 pawns at the beginning of the match
The capturing is obligatory

1. The pawns can only move forwards, left or right, one square at a time, changing the colour of the square.
2. A pawn making a capturing move (a jump) leaps over one of the opponent's pawns. Only one pawn may be captured in a single jump; however, when possible the player must perform multiple jumps in one move.
3. The pawns capture opposing pawns by jumping over them to the nearest square of the same colour. To do this they may only move diagonally in four directions, not to the left or to the right, forwards or backwards.
4. Captured pawns are removed from the chessboard.

137630.name: Angulus
137630.description:
Angulus is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in November 2012. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares. The chessmen move in all directions from one to three squares in maximum depending if it is a pawn, a piece or a king.

The goal of the game is to capture the opponent's king.

In each turn the player moves only one chessman.
In the game there are three kinds of chessmen: pawn, piece and king:

- Pawns can move one square in each direction (horizontally, vertically and diagonally) and capture the opponent's chessman diagonally.

- Pieces can move and capture from 1 to 2 squares in each direction (horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

- King can move and capture from 1 to 3 squares in each direction (horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

The opponent's chessmen are captured like in chess game.

137631.name: Plaguewrought Prism

rpgseries.39645: EPIC - Living Forgotten Realms Epic Campaign Adventures

137631.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

When faced with a threat that even the gods fear, the powers of Faerûn turn to you. Unfortunately, there is far too much to do in what little time remains. You have only split seconds to prevent the coming apocalypse. A three-round Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Faerûn for 27th level characters. This adventure is a direct sequel to EPIC4-3 Dark Hearts of Madness.

137632.name: Morthac's Mansion
137632.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

A typical briefing is interrupted with urgent intelligence about a tactical advantage that could be gained by the resistance against the occupying forces in Elturel. Can you secure a location vital to the resistance? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Elturgard for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).

This adventure is a sequel to ELTU4-4 and is also connected to the events of SPEC5-1 and ADCP5-1. Note: This is a combat-intensive adventure.

137633.name: Closer to the Heart
137633.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Restoring the Companion would be the first step toward retaking control of Elturel. Someone must journey into the depths of the Astral Sea to recover the final component, known as the Heart of Light, for the ritual that would restore the Companion. But to find the Heart requires more than just skill. Only the Trinity can lead the way. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). The adventure is a loose sequel to ELTU4- 4, and connected to SPEC5-1 and ADCP5-1. Plot-wise, the events of this adventure take place before ADCP5-1.

137634.name: Black Fire Pass: A Guide to Adventures on the Fringe of the Empire
137634.description:
From publisher blurb:

The alliance between dwarfs and men has lasted since the time of Sigmar, forged in blood at the Battle of Black Fire Pass. A disturbing place of sharp black glass and noxious mists, Black Fire Pass has been fraught with peril and opportunity throughout the long history of the Empire. Trade caravans and invading armies alike must pass through its narrow confines to cross the Black Mountains, making this storied site of utmost importance to dwarfs and men alike. What dangers and riches does it hold for you?

Black Fire Pass, a supplement for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, presents a wealth of new information concerning dwarfs, the hold of Karak Azgaraz, and Black Fire Pass itself.

Please note that this is not a complete product. The full retail version of this product has many components which are not included with this PDF, such as cards and tokens. A copy of the full retail version of this product is required in order to use this product.

137635.name: Book of Grudges: A Guide to Dwarfs & the Everlasting Realm
137635.description:
From publisher blurb:

The alliance between dwarfs and men has lasted since the time of Sigmar, forged in blood at the Battle of Black Fire Pass. A disturbing place of sharp black glass and noxious mists, Black Fire Pass has been fraught with peril and opportunity throughout the long history of the Empire. Trade caravans and invading armies alike must pass through its narrow confines to cross the Black Mountains, making this storied site of utmost importance to dwarfs and men alike. What dangers and riches does it hold for you?

The Book of Grudges features rules for runesmithing, dwarf engineering, ten brand-new dwarf careers, and much more; a must-have addition for fans of these stout and stoic warriors. Also included in the box are details on the history and geography of Black Fire Pass itself, with adventure and episode ideas for GMs and a complete adventure set within the its dangerous confines. When friend becomes foe, thunder will reign in the mountains.

Black Fire Pass, a supplement for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, presents a wealth of new information concerning dwarfs, the hold of Karak Azgaraz, and Black Fire Pass itself.

Please note that this is not a complete product. The full retail version of this product has many components which are not included with this PDF, such as cards and tokens. A copy of the full retail version of this product is required in order to use this product.

137636.name: Die Janus-Gesellschaft
137636.description:
from the back of the book

The world is a conspirationand the PCs are in its mids. As members of a secret society they fathom the dark world of the Unknown.
Using th sign of the doublefaced Janus-head since 1690 people meet to unearth the mysteries of mankind in a scientific way. The society is helping them with a hidden network of bases, the faculties.
Sometimes, the Janobite meet the foul Cthulhu-mythos. And the denagerous knowlegde not only brings death, but the characters might also find out that not everyone of the society is on thier side.

137637.description:
Hidden Intruder is a reprint/re-skin of Intruder: a one player board game that re-creates the theme and feel of the movie "Alien". The game can also be played with 1-3 players.

The goal is to survive an encounter with an alien "intruder" on a space ship.

According to the Print & Play website:

"The Intruder is an alien being of unknown power. During the course of the game the Intruder will move through the space station as both the hunter and the hunted. One or more players must cope with a monster that moves rapidly and changes continuously as it undergoes metamorphosis into a more powerful being, and possibly divides into two or more clones.

Hidden Intruder is a solitaire game – BUT it has 3 “scenarios” or different ways to play that allow for 2-3 players to play.
-Intelligent Intruder (One player plays the Intruder)
-Return to Prometheus (One player plays the Intruder, or 3 players each take a team of 3 troops)
-Science Officers (2 players, each control a separate team, with slightly different win conditions, allowing for one player or both players or neither player to win)

The game includes 54 counters representing the crew and their weapons, lab animals (which confuse the search) and the Intruder. The playing map shows in detail the interior of deep space station ‘Prometheus’. The map also contains special charts to record the development of the Intruder.

Hidden Intruder is an exciting game of terror and suspense for one to two players. Hidden Intruder is a reskin of the old Classic game, Intruder. Dennis Sustare, designer of Intruder, has agreed to let me reprint his game with this new art."
137637.name: Hidden Intruder

137639.name: Quest: Brian's Journey

videogameversion.198459: North American Game Boy Color edition

137639.description:
Quest RPG: Brian's Journey was released on the Game Boy Color. It is a port of the Nintendo 64 game, Quest 64. The game is not a direct port, some areas are different as well as some text and bosses. It was released February 3rd, 2000. Originally released under the name "Quest RPG" then was later changed to add the "Brian's journey" at the end of the title.

The plot is a close replica of the original story. The playable character is an apprentice mage named Brian. Brian sets off to find his father who has left the monastery of the mages—the player learns later that his father is looking for a thief who has stolen the "Eletale Book". The player must also collect elemental amulets, which have been hoarded by powerful criminals and are integral in the defeat of the game's final boss.

Source: Wikipedia, "Quest RPG: Brian's Journey", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137640.name: Al Murray The Pub Landlord Ultimate Pub Quiz
137640.description:
The Nation's Favourite Pub Landlord brings you this Ultimate Pub Quiz. Think you're the brain of the bar? Well now's your chance to prove it as you choose your teams and work your way through a random selection of 1000 questions on everything British. From History to TV to Music to Sports, and a picture round as well, it's a test for any boffin or braniac. With a selection of questions written by the Landlord himself, who presides over the quiz behind his special bar board, it's the Ultimate Pub Quiz in your own home.

Box Contains 1 x Board 250 x Cards across 3 decks 2 x pencils 1 x dice Answer pad Rulebook

137641.name: Quest: Fantasy Challenge

videogameversion.198462: North American Game Boy Color edition

137641.description:
User Summary

Control Brian from the N64 game Quest 64 and try to collect all the gems in each arena, avoiding the enemies. Shoot the monsters with your wand, but keep moving because enemies will keep on appearing. Once all the gems are collected, you can move on to the next level.

137642.name: R-Type DX

videogameversion.198463: North American Game Boy Color edition

137642.description:
Back of the box

The World Government needs your help.
A deep-space probe has uncovered the Bydo Empire's secret plans to mount an attack on Earth. A full-scale assault force would be detected by the Empire's long-range scanners, and any hope of surprise would be lost. Our only chance is for a single pilot in a lone R-Type fighter to penetrate the Bido defense system and destroy the evil Empire before it can launch its attack.

- It's five games in one! R-Type I and II for Game Boy pocket, R-Type I and II color-enhanced for Game Boy Color, and the all new R-Type DX for the Game Boy Color.
- Tear through Bido defenses as you blast enemies with your Fire Chain, Super Laser and Bubble Beam.
- Take the fight to a fevered pitch with two pulse-pounding Rapid Fire modes on your Game Boy Color system.

137643.name: Racin' Ratz

videogameversion.198464: North American Game Boy Color edition

137643.description:
User Summary

Control your Racin' Ratz vehicle and drive through different rooms in the house to complete missions. Solving each puzzle-like mission involves setting up the room with ramps and objects needed and doing things in a certain order to get the desired effects.

137645.name: Zaczarowana Kraina
137645.description:
It's a game directed mainly at children where they roll a die to move on the track and draw special cards. It's a kind of trivia race, but there is no finishing line - the game ends when one particular card is drawn ("Matołek the Billy-Goat" - a character from popular Polish comic books for children). During the game you have the opportunity to test your knowledge about Świętokrzyskie Province, to become acquainted with legends and famous sites from this area and to collect "emeryks" (which is the goal of the game). But you have to be careful of a highwayman called Madej and his clubs.

From the publisher's website:
A board game about the attractions of Świętokrzyskie Province.
The game Zaczarowana Kraina provides you with lots of excitement and healthy competition among family and friends at the same time getting you to know the beauty of nature, cultural wealth and fascinating past of Świętokrzyskie Province. The game encourages you also to visit some or all of presented sites.

137646.name: Rescue Heroes: Fire Frenzy

videogameversion.198470: North American Game Boy Color edition

137646.description:
User Summary

An children's game based on the Mattel toy line and television series, Rescue Heroes. Help rescue people from blazing fires and other bad events.

137647.name: Return of the Ninja

videogameversion.198471: North American Game Boy Color edition

137647.description:
User Summary

An action game with strategy. As a ninja, you try to remain unseen. Taking out enemies before they see you will be a big help. If you are seen, there will be more enemies later on in the level. Rankings are earned on each level based on how quickly you completed it and how few times you were seen by enemies.

137649.description:
Game description from the publisher:

LEVEL 7 [Omega Protocol] picks up right where LEVEL 7 [ESCAPE] left off. The Subterra Bravo facility has been thrown into chaos through the players actions in [ESCAPE], and now the government has sent in a top-secret, highly-trained special forces unit to shut down the facility and eliminate everything remaining in the base.

In [Omega Protocol], one player takes on the role of the Overseer while two to five other players take on the role of the elite Special Ops team. The Overseer's role in the game is to control all of the alien denizens and challenges the players face throughout the game. The players are trying to achieve specific scenario-based objectives by exploring a map that's laid out at the start and fighting off the hordes of aliens that the Overseer sends their way.

Gameplay is based around adrenaline, which is the currency that the soldier players use to perform actions. They generate adrenaline to do things such as move, attack, and perform special actions like activating an objective space. That generation also has a negative effect for them, as that adrenaline transfers to the Overseer player, who then uses it to spawn aliens, create new threats, and hurt the soldiers' chance of success during the scenario. The more actions the Special Ops players take, the more resources the Overseer player has to work with.

Characters in [Omega Protocol] are represented by miniatures, and each Special Ops and alien character has different attributes, powers, and customizable skills and equipment.
137649.name: Level 7 [Omega Protocol]

137650.name: Pathways (Issue 23 - Feb 2013)
137650.description:
Pathways
Issue #23
Pathways Beyond The Stars!
February 2013
Cover by Gennifer Bone

137651.description:
Now that you've got some experience as an Evil Doctor, it's time to move onward and upward. Where's the place to be in the Evil Doctoring World of the late 1800s? London. What's your plan? Find a cheap warehouse somewhere to build your Doomsday Machine. Scotland Yard is on your trail, however, so in addition to your Doomsday Machine, you'll have to build an Escape Plan.

In the worker-placement style game What's He Building in There?, players use their Doctors and three henchmen to acquire resources at the available shops, acquire gold, visit the black markets, provide the "Genius at Work" labor (GAW), provide "Manual Labor" (ML), improve the Doctor's social standing, and invent things. You must complete both a Doomsday Machine and an Escape Plan, with higher level Doomsday Machines and Escape Plans garnering more victory points, and you need to do it quickly. Scotland Yard is getting suspicious, after all, so you have to do what you need to do in 15 turns. Players can earn additional victory points for fitting in with society, eccentricity, security and inventions.

Play time is approximately 25-30 minutes per player.
137651.name: What's He Building in There?

137652.name: Schiffe Versenken
137652.description:
Schiffe Versenken has the same rules as Battleship but instead of 5 ships from lengths 2-5 each player has 10 ships from lengths 1-4.

Each player has:

4 size 1 ships
3 size 2 ships
2 size 3 ships
1 size 4 ship




Players place their ship on a gridded 10X10 piece of paper and keep track of their hits and misses with pencil.

137653.name: Nonpoint
137653.description:
Nonpoint is an abstract strategy game for 2–3 players, with a solitaire variant. It is to be played with a 37-hex-hex board and a XATS set.

Your score is the product of the numbers of your pieces in contiguous groups (as in OMEGA), minus the number of points (i.e. the tips) on your pieces you haven’t played. Maximize your score! The solitaire rules are the same, except that all same-colored contiguous groups are factors in your score, and all colors' leftover points penalize you.

On your turn, place one of your pieces on the board according to the following rules:

Pieces are not allowed to point at their own color in an adjacent space!
No two adjacent pieces are allowed to point at each other!
You must place it in a space already pointed to by an adjacent piece belonging to an opponent.
It is not allowed to point out of the edge of the board. If there is no valid play for you, you simply pass your turn. If all players pass consecutively, the game is over.

137654.name: Tee-Kesselchen

boardgamefamily.21540: HABA Game in a Tin series

137654.description:
A children's game where two players take a Teekesselchen card. A "Teekesselchen" is a term with two different meanings. Each card depicts two homonymous pictures. The two players choose which side they are in charge of and they begin describing the pictures. The first player describes her picture and then the second explains how his is different.

Example:
First player: My Teekesselchen is something you can eat.
Second player: Not mine.

The other players can ask yes or no questions and are trying to guess both the term and two different meanings in order to earn the card. The player who guesses is then part of the team that describes the next card. After all the cards have been guessed the player with the most wins.

137655.name: The Aerial Derby
137655.description:
Pre-WW1 game, featuring the relatively new world of aviation.

The game is not very 'new' in the sense that it is a Goose-type race game. Move according to the die, obey instructions of every special square and the first to 'fly' around the world, wins.

As a side observation, space 20 foretold events that would happen 100 years later "New York, collides with a skyscraper, back to 8".

137656.name: Wer kennt Dortmund?
137656.description:
"Who knows Dortmund - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Dortmund.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

remarks:
Designer and artist Mark Altfuldisch selects different 'local experts' from each city to create appropiate questions; consequently each city has different designers listed on the box-side.

137659.name: Surface Warship 1939-1943
137659.description: SURFACE WARSHIP 1939-1943 is rules and equipment for tactical World War II naval simulation games. Each player is the captain of a ship. In a 30-second time limit turn, he moves his ship and fires his guns. The gunnery effectiveness is determined by the captain himself, since he ranges his guns by eye and guess. A system of points is used to evaluate damage to ships - how much speed and armament they lose. Torpedoes are fired by pointing a marker in a certain direction and moving it as the torpedo moves. An umpire is necessary in the game because many arguments will arrise about hits and misses, and many additional factors can be included in the game with an umpire.

137662.name: Wer kennt Bonn?
137662.description:
"Who knows Bonn - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Bonn.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

137666.name: Pleasure Planet
137666.description:
[Taken from the Introduction.]
You’re hired to help a retired Templar Supernova find a myth of epic proportions, The Pleasure Planet. He thinks that he has the key that’ll unlock the way, but if you had a credit for every time someone said that you’d be rich. He’s paid the fee, so it’s up to you to do his dirty work for the next little while.

137667.name: Wer kennt Freiburg?
137667.description:
Who knows Freiburg - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Freiburg.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

137668.name: Get Thee Behind Me...
137668.description:
This is a self published board game by Doctor Mike Reddy, based on an idea by David Prior and Matthew Simmons, which can be played on Checkers/Othello boards with regular pieces. It was submitted to the One Game A Month project.

Players move pieces from their back row in a manner similar to checkers, that is diagonally forward. However, pieces can also move directly backwards one space, allowing for advance and retreat. Taking of opponent's pieces is limited to manoeuvring behind the other player's counters from the side; hence the name.

Basic strategy involves the creation of temporary vertical or horizontal lines, as both of these patterns prevent to a legal take manoeuvre; the former prevents (in the short term) the opponent from being able get to the side, the latter the completion of a take because the rear of pieces are protected. However, such structures are not sustainable for long, especially as players lose pieces.

137669.description:
The Sky People retreated above the clouds and left the Borderlands to crumble and decay. The old machines are rusted and broken and the scavengers of Gearworld live off scraps from the past and refuse from the Sky People's flying cities. The scavengers' only hope for a better life is to build great towering skyworks and gain the favor of the World Above, allowing them to outlast and outlive their rival scavenger gangs. In the Borderlands, survival is an exception.

Gearworld: The Borderlands is a game of conquest and survival in a post-apocalyptic world for 2-4 players who must gather resources and use them wisely. Players need those resources in order to strengthen their military might, to enhance their transport capabilities, and to reach the final goal of building the skyworks. Resources can be produced in areas with resource tokens, traded with other players, and taken by force. To build a development – e.g., weapons, transport vehicles or skyworks – all of the required resources have to be located in the same space on the map. This makes effective transport an important issue in the game. At the same time players must be strong enough to protect their resources from the other players while investing resources in their skyworks in order to win the game.

Seize territory, marshal resources and defend yourself from your rivals. Reclaim the machines of old to build powerful weapons and enormous skyworks. Can you forge a new future from the rusted remnants of the past?

Microbadges:

Gearworld: The Borderlands fan
137669.name: Gearworld: The Borderlands

137670.name: Mynd
137670.description:
This game for 2-4 players is superficially similar to GO, with players taking turns laying stones on a 11 x 11, 16 x 16 or 19×19 grid of intersections. However, unlike Go where placed pieces are static or captured, Mynd (the Welsh word for go) shows its diversity using a push/pull mechanic that allows lines of pieces to be moved along lines (horizontally or vertically), according to a simple tug-of-war mechanic. Therefore, this is more an ongoing battle that the traditional game, with the status of claimed territory being under constant attack as walled off sections of the board are pressured by force of numbers. The game ends when there is no legal move left, the board fills up, or, more often, when both players agree to end it, at which time whoever controls the most territory wins.

As an additional game reusing the Go aesthetic, utilising the same general-purpose grid and colored stones, it is hoped this will join the variety of other abstract strategy games that can be played with a Go set, such as Connect6, Go-Moku, Pente, and others.

137671.name: Space Fortress
137671.description:
From the Back of the Book

When the Fiber People's gigantic Space Fortress is detected hurtling toward Earth, the Space Hawks are called into action. Are these highly advanced aliens planning to save mankind or destroy it? You can't be sure.

As a Space Hawk, it's up to you to establish contact and board their vessel, no matter how dangerous, and find out what these strange creatures have in store for you--and Earth!

137672.name: The Comet Masters
137672.description:
From the Back of the Book

When several comets are seen heading straight for Earth, the Space Hawks are called to action. You have reason to believe that an advanced and powerful alien race called the Comet Masters is controlling the comets, but for what purpose?

It's up to the Space Hawks to find out. Together you must find a way to deflect the comets and save the planet from certain destruction!

137673.name: Hi-Tech
137673.description:
User's summary:

Fan-made sourcebook about advanced technologies in Neuroshima world.

137674.name: The Fiber People
137674.description:
From the Back of the Book

As a Space Hawk, you first encountered the mysterious Fiber People when their space fortress was detected hurtling toward Earth. But then they suddenly vanished, leaving the solar system at faster-than-light-speed. Now you must find them. Only they know who is the powerful force behind the series of threats to Earth's existence. The Space Hawks are called to action. Those who were once Earth's greatest enemy are now its only hope!

137675.name: Junk Ship Yard
137675.description:
User's summary:

Fan-made sourcebook described as expansion for official sourcebook: Piraci.

137676.name: Schroniarze
137676.description:
User's summary:

Fan-made sourcebook about a social group.

137677.name: The Planet Eater
137677.description:
From the Back of the Book

As a Space Hawk, you've gone up against some of the most deadly enemies in the solar system. But you've never faced an opponent as awesome as Nemesis. This all-powerful alien, with its 400,000-mile-long spaceship, devours any planet in its path--and Earth is next. It's a challenge only the Space Hawks can meet--or can they? Unless the Space Hawks can overcome Nemesis, Earth is doomed!

137678.name: Ołów
137678.description:
User's summary:

Fan-made sourcebook about weapons, mostly firearms.

137680.name: Immortal Night
137680.description:
Who are you? Vampire or Werewolf?

The world of Immortal Night awakens your true self. A world shrouded in darkness, where the supernatural reigns and Mist and Mysticism are seeped in every move. Play the game of a life transformed by blood and venom. Where silver and holy water are weapons of mass destruction. Where demons thrive and the things of nightmares creep around every corner.

Vampires and Werewolves...allies or enemies? You decide as you evade human hunters while traveling around the globe feasting, prowling and battling rival Houses for territory. Become one of the privileged, establish your House as dominant, consult the tarot, throw the bones, collect Mythical Objects to aid in your Mischief. Grow your fangs and secure your seat on the council as you claw your way through the ranks to get to Ancient and take supreme power.

Source: The Game Website.

137681.name: Hellfire
137681.description:
Publisher's Blurb:


Cthulhu Mythos adventure in 18th century London


When a raid on a high-class brothel uncovers sinister doings, the clues lead the Bow Street Runners to a most unexpected and horrific conclusion.

An adventure for Dark Streets.

137682.description:
This is an Advanced Squad Leader campaign game, using a couple of standard ASL mapboards.

Achtung! Panzer! offers a series of interrelated scenarios pertaining to the conflict on the Somme from late May to early June 1940. Using this system, a number of scenarios are played, each simulating a portion of the action which took place on that date.
137682.name: Achtung! Panzer!

137683.name: Against the Cult of Chaos
137683.description:
From the back of the book

An ancient evil stirs in the Caves of Chaos, chipping away at its prison, while the forces of chaos converge on the nearby town of Hommel Lane. Monstrous raiders, marauding bandits, and missing villagers portend a terrible fate for Hommel Lane and the Rest of the world, if unchallenged.

137684.name: Cthulhus Ruf Extrablatt (Special Issue 02 - Gratisrollenspieltag Feb 2013)
137684.description:
user summary

This special issue of Cthulhus Rud contains 7 short scenarios, named after the 7 deadly sins:
1. Neid - Wer hoch steigt (for CoC 1920s)
2. Wollust - Der Donaufürst (for CoC 1920s)
3. Hochmut - Spiegel des Wahnsinns (for CoC 1920s)
4. Zorn - Licht und Finsternis (for CoC No Man's land/World War One)
5. Völlerei - Carnivale de Goules (for CoC Gaslight)
6. Faulheit - Der Wald hinterm Haus (for CoC Now)
7. Geiz - Die Leiche im Moor (for CoC 1920s)

It was given out for free on Feb 2, 2013, on the German Free RPG Day: Gratisrollenspieltag 2013

137685.name: Muses
137685.description:
In Muses you are an aspiring artist seeking inspiration from the nine Muses of mythology. Each Muse that you encounter will gain you inspiration points and assistance in encountering her sisters. You may also call upon hints gleaned from the works of classical authors.

It is a very quick, solitaire dice and card game. It is comprised of nine cards and three tokens and requires two standard D6s. There is no setup required and you can play through a full game in under five minutes. There is a significant element of luck in the game but players must make the right tactical choices to capitalise on that luck.

Each of the nine cards represents one of the Muses. On the card is a point value and - in most cases - a dice manipulation power, to be gained by encountering that Muse. Around the edge of the cards are between one and four conditions that you must meet on the two dice in order to encounter that Muse. Each turn the player draws a new card, turns any unclaimed cards 90 degrees clockwise and rolls the two dice. Using any powers they have acquired, the player then tries to claim (encounter) one of the active cards by matching the condition currently showing at the top of the card. Cards which are not encountered before they run out of claim conditions are discarded.


Update. A new edition of Muses is now available at www.goodlittlegames.co.uk

boardgamecompilation.138594: Family Charades In A Box Compendium

137686.description:
Charades game with 80's theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137686.name: Charades In-A-Box: 80s

boardgamecompilation.138594: Family Charades In A Box Compendium

137687.description:
Charades game with 70's theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137687.name: Charades In-A-Box: 70s

137688.description:
Charades game with American theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137688.name: Charades In-A-Box: American

137689.description:
Charades game with Canadian theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137689.name: Charades In-A-Box: Canadian

boardgamecompilation.138594: Family Charades In A Box Compendium

137690.description:
Charades game with Family theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137690.name: Charades In-A-Box: Family

boardgamecompilation.138594: Family Charades In A Box Compendium

137691.description:
Charades game with animal theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137691.name: Charades In-A-Box: Party Animal

137692.description:
Charades game with Rock and Roll theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137692.name: Charades In-A-Box: Rock and Roll

boardgamecompilation.138594: Family Charades In A Box Compendium

137693.description:
Charades game with Hollywood theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137693.name: Charades In-A-Box: Hollywood

137694.description:
Charades game with Celebrity theme.

Players must perform and guess a whole host of fun charades that will have everyone laughing out loud. Each charade is ranked by difficulty – the harder the charade the more points your team can earn by guessing it correctly. The team with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.
137694.name: Charades In-A-Box: Celebrity

137695.name: Rechenmax
137695.description:
Objective: be the first passing target (100) & learning maths (first rules of arithmetic)
- acting/moving by turns -
example: addition
turn the spinner, add number to current position & move forward; ending on a marked space follow instructions. Hitting another meeple player must move back 10 spaces.

137696.name: Music Game: Level 1
137696.description:
Players advance around the "Keyboard" style board with classic wooden pawns by rolling the dice and correctly answering question cards from six categories.
Players get to 'jump' one another, land on 'move forward/back' keys, 'buy' key moves' answer music trivia and practice drawing music.

137697.name: Trivial Pursuit Music Edition: from Pop-Rock to Classic
137697.description: CD version of Trivial Pursuit in its Music edition. From Pop-Rock to Classic music, the CD features a song/composition and the players must answer the question related to the track.

137698.name: Reisepass: Nicholas Nelson
137698.description:
Roughly translated from back page:

"Bullets" provides the muscle for the detective firm of Keyes & Nelson Investigations in Brooklyn. The straight-shooting investigator is clever, but has little sense of tact...

user comment
a pre-generated NPC

137699.name: Reisepass: Danny O'Bannon
137699.description:
Roughly translated from back page:

Officially, O'Bannon is the head of a transportation company in Arkham. Unofficially, he's the boss of the town's organized crime. Thanks to his Irish ancestry, he works together with corresponding gangsters in Boston and New York...

user comment
a pre-generated NPC

137700.name: Das Waldmännchen-Spiel
137700.description:
Objective: be the first reaching the centre of the board
- acting/moving by turns -
each player rolls the die & moves into direction of her/his choice; ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on lid inside; due to the turning wheel below the board after the turns ways become blocked or unlocked.

137701.name: Savage Worlds Gentleman's Edition Revised: Probefahrt
137701.description:
User summary:

A quick-start edition of the Revised Gentleman's Edition of savage Worlds. Includes rules specifically for fantasy settings as an example, a brief FA, and the one-sheet scenario Das Geheimnis der Leuchtenden Steine by Sebastian Deutsch and Sascha Schnitzer.

Provided by Prometheus Games for Gratisrollenspieltag 2013.

137702.name: Der Zeitreisende
137702.description:
Loosely translated from back cover:

A curios reporter, an ingenious inventor and an honest-to-goodness time machine - and thus begins an exciting adventure of a somewhat different nature!

Provided by Uhrwerk Verlag for Gratisrollenspieltag 2013.

137703.name: Der Letzte Widerstand
137703.description:
Loosely translated from cover:

"Der letzte Widerstand" is a scenario for FateToGo. It is set in the not too distant future, in which the earth has been occupied by alien invaders, in the tradition of "War of the Worlds".

Provided by proindie for Gratisrollenspieltag 2013.

137704.name: Dypgraeven: Die Schachtstadt
137704.description:
User summary:'

A description of Dypgraeven, pop. 1500, complete with background, game statistics, and even a local children's rhyme.

Provided by Uhrwerk Verlag for Gratisrollenspieltag 2013.

137706.name: Die Schatzkarte
137706.description:
Loosely translated from back cover:

A mysterious robbery took place at the Museum of Seestadt. An old scroll was stolen. It was covered with mysterious hieroglyphics, which nobody has been able to decipher. Why did the thief only steal this worthless parchment?

Given away at Gratisrollenspieltag 2013.

137707.name: Sango Fighter 2
137707.description:
User Summary

Also known as Fighter in China 2, Sango Fighter 2 is a fighting game set in the historical Three Kingdoms period of Chinese history. It features sixteen fighters from that period - an increase of four from the previous game. The game has three modes: Conquer China, Warriors Battle, and Two Player Matchups.

137708.name: The Struggle For New France (1754-1762)
137708.description:
The Battle for New France is an introductory level point to point movement war game for the Seven Years War (1754-1762), focusing on events occurring in North America as a grand campaign game.

The game focuses on ease of play with the use of cards to determine reinforcements, political issues and supply problems with out creating a lot extra rules. The Indians of North American and how they influenced the French and Indian war is well represented along with leaders and special units such as Roger's Rangers and seige guns.

Struggle for New France is a two player game but may also be played solitaire. Players will need to move their army points along the point paths and also with the use of their combat cards to outguess what their opponent is also trying to do. The playing cards effect may aspects of the game from supply, political issues and reinforcements. However the cards do not make the game since you are only allowed to play one card per turn.

137709.name: Cybersphere Plus
137709.description:
User Summary

Cybersphere Plus is the sequel to Cybersphere, a flashy block clearing game that featured the classic ball-and-paddle gameplay of games like Break Out.
Cybersphere Plus includes more colourful levels, more techno, new powerups, and more bizarre or challenging rooms.

137710.name: We Be Goblins Too!

rpghonor.26125: 2014 ENnie for Best Free Game - Gold Winner

137710.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Licktoads, once the great and fierce goblin tribe in Brinestump Marsh, were defeated by human adventurers! All that remains of the tribe are its four goblin "heroes"—Reta Bigbad the fighter, Chuffy Lickwound the rogue, Poog the cleric of Zarongel, and Mogmurch the alchemist. Homeless and bored, they left their swampy homeland to join the neighboring goblin tribe, the Birdcrunchers.

The good news is that the Birdcrunchers are willing to let the goblin heroes join their tribe.

The better news is that the Birdcrunchers have heard of these four, and want one of them to become their new chieftain.

The bad news is that before the goblins can join, they'll need to endure a series of dangerous and humiliating tests. Very dangerous. Very humiliating.

The worse news is that lately Birdcruncher chieftains have had really short lifespans—they're being killed by the pet fire-breathing boar of a local ogre who wants the Birdcruncher land as his own.

Can the four heroes of the now-dead Licktoad tribe save the Birdcrunchers and, in so doing, become their new leaders?

"We Be Goblins Too!" is an adventure for four 3rd-level goblin characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world's oldest roleplaying game. The adventure takes place near the coastal town of Sandpoint in the Pathfinder campaign setting, and serves as a sequel to 'We Be Goblins,' Paizo's popular 2011 Free RPG Day adventure!

137711.name: Goblins! Rulebook (Beta)
137711.description:
designer summary

You know those nights where everyone seems to have a problem staying on target? Where every little thing the GM says is taken out of context? Where the ability to make a funny joke is more important to the players than actually following a plot?
Welcome to Goblins!

GM: “There’s a fork in the road ahead.”
Player: “How many tines does it have? Can I use it as a weapon? I challenge the fork! ‘HO THERE, FORK!’ No answer? I attack the fork!”

In your normal game the GM would be casting about for ways to rain anvils on the characters first, and potentially the players second. In Goblins!, that kind of thing is sort of par for the course. It gives you a chance to play around with these annoying jokes and random distractions in character. We think it’s kind of fun.

If you’re tired of saving the world from cosmic horrors, if you’ve killed your 37th ancient dragon, if you’re bored of playing an arch wizard from the dawn of time, kick your pointy shoes off and slum it with the grimy little beggars called Goblins!

A game for those whose idea of victory is keeping down dinner, whose concept of high adventure is testing out the Hag’s new mushroom collection, whose ambitions range all the way to the dizzying heights of leading their own small army of cockroaches. In their pants.

137712.name: Monkey Isle
137712.description:
Title page:
A Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game Adventure
For Characters of Levels 4 to 6

Rising out of the vast emptiness of the blue ocean is a lush green island filled with ancient beasts and scattered strange ruins waiting to be explored.

from the introduction:
Monkey Isle is a "lost world" setting - an island inhabited by prehistoric beasts and other strange creatures. It includes background material for the GM (Game Master) and several ready-made adventures. The intent is to give the GM an island to use for their own adventures. It is a place the gamers can visit and revisit as they desire.

This adventure was designed for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game, available for free from www.basicfantasy.org, but can in fact be used with a variety of “old school” fantasy RPG systems.

137714.name: Imangi
137714.description:
User Summary

Imangi is a word game where the player can slide letters in columns or rows, and then highlight letters that form words following the scrabble/crossword rules that all left-to-right and top-to-bottom arrangements of used letters of two or more must form valid words.

Certain letters are highlighted on the array. These are worth more when used in words than regular letters.

The game includes online leaderboards, where players can compete for high scores on the daily challenge puzzles.

137715.name: Dreh' und nimm!
137715.description:
Objective: be the first completing your image/figure
- acting by turns -

each player chooses a figure to complete & turns the spinner (6 symbols - right/left arm, right/left leg, body, head); active player may take one correspondent piece out of 6 different figures (representing professions), distributed over the table;
you may play the game with older children, turning pieces upside down (memory effect).

137716.name: Sega Saturn Backup Memory
137716.description:
User Summary

A "memory card" for the Sega Saturn, to enhance the internal save memory. The cartridge was so large for its time that there was no real use for more than 1 of these – it could hold the save data for hundred of games.

137717.name: Shuttle Mouse
137717.description:
User Summary

The Saturn mouse. It was famous for actually being useful in a lot of games, as the Saturn was the "Nerd console" and had a lot of PC game ports.

137718.name: Monster Horrorshow
137718.description:
From the back of the book:

A multi-player adventure game for you to run. If you can. If you dare.

Monster Horrorshow is a magical world of nightmare and adventure where you and your friends fight for survival. Here you can live (and die) for days, weeks, months, even years - because, unlike any other adventure gamebook, Monster Horrorshow takes place in your head.

First you have to learn how to become a Werewizard, someone who will run the whole show. The ultimate referee whose word is law. To qualify you have to pass through the dreaded Labyrinth of Squat, a short solo adventure. Then the Horrorshow begins.

Everything you need to run the Horrorshow is here including a complete game system, monster cards and a ready-to-play horror adventure scenario. But remember, this is only the beginning, the real game depends on your imagination...

137719.name: O Moselstrand; o selig Land!
137719.description:
Objective: be the first ending on target space (Coblenz 62)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game -
Starting in Trier roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on cover inside

remarks:
published early 1930's
meeples: pewter figures

137720.name: King Oddball
137720.description:
User Summary

King Oddball Ends the World is a physics-based destruction game where you control King Oddball, a round headed creature who throws projectiles at enemies by hurling them with his tongue. Complete the levels by destroying all the enemies, and complete the game by completing all the levels.

137722.name: Quicksilver (Pathfinder Edition)
137722.description:
From the back of the book

Seloria seems such a simple land, a place of knighthood, nobility, and magery. The Sprites, Elves and Humans live alongside one another in peace.

However, within your lifetime, the king has granted the three lowly Goblin races full citizenship, and not all are content to grant them equality.

The balances of power are shifting, and those who possess the rare and precious metal Quicksilver will play a part.

Quicksilver is enchanted via psychic power. It can grant its wielder abilities both unusual or mundane.

Those who would do so must beware! Frightening and dangerous creatures are spawned from fumbled attempt to control it!

The world of Seloria was created by legendary TSR artist Jeff Dee, co-creator of the classic superhero role-playing game Villains & Vigilantes, and Talzhemir, co-creator of Furcadia!


User summary

This is the Pathfinder adaption of the Quicksilver RPG. It describes the world of Seloria and its races and classes. It contains a bestiary, and rules for psionics and manipulating Quicksilver.

137723.name: Valour of Ages
137723.description:
From the intro

Valour of Ages is a valuable fan-created resource for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay 3rd edition. It provides all players with additional insight and background into playing elves. It includes new rules for elves, new backgrounds, additional careers, special items, history, and adventures.

Also included in this supplement is additional information on elven lands, dark elves, and wood elves.

Supplemental material was created with Hurlanc's the Strange Eons program for card and sheet format as well.

137724.name: Burger Cat
137724.description:
During a normal BBQ a catastrophic event sent Burger Cat's burgers all over 85 levels! Hungry and wanting to eat these delicious cheeseburgers; you will use your tools to navigate through the levels. Retrieve the burger in each level while overcoming obstacles.

Source: The Publisher Website.

137725.name: BraveSmart
137725.description:
BraveSmart is a clever Match 3 Puzzle Game.

It’s addictive: You’ll pick it up in a second and won’t be able to put it down for hours.

EASY TO LEARN, HARD TO MASTER

Learn to play the game during the short tutorial and hone your skills throughout the campaign.

INTUITIVE SWIPE GAMEPLAY

Use the Swipe motion with your finger to combine resources into buildings, buildings into bigger buildings and eventually even castles. The longer the chains, the higher the points value.

GREAT REPLAY VALUE

Visit levels played before to improve the score, gather Achievements (Gamecenter only) or earn Crowns, the ingame currency. Also, it might be worthwhile to employ and test a number of different tactics.

Source: The Developer Website.

137726.name: Wild West
137726.description:
Wild West is played with 48 cards made up of 14 different sharp shooting characters and four plastic pop guns that fire a ping-pong ball.

Contained in these 48 cards are 8 cards illustrating wanted outlaws. These 8 outlaws are also hiding in the rest of the cards. One special agent card is also included which, when played, automatically entitles the player to arrest any one of the wanted outlaws.

The object of the game is to collect three of the wanted outlaws.

Place all the wanted cards face up in a circle in the centre of the table.
Each player takes a gun and places it in front of himself on the table.
Choose a dealer, who shuffles the rest of the cards and deals them out one at a time face down to each player until the pack is finished. Each player then stacks the cards face down in front of himself .The player to the left of the dealer starts the game by playing the top card of his hand face up in front of himself. Play continues in a clockwise direction.
When any player turns over a card which he thinks is a wanted man, he should shout "Ambush" and go for his gun.The one who sees the wanted man first obviously has the advantage but he does not win the wanted card until he shoots any one of the players who have now become the outiaws. The one that shoots and scores first wins the wanted card and places it in front of himself. Should the player accidentally shoot the wrong sharp shooting character he should either:-
1. miss a go if he holds no wanted cards and be shot by the other players or
2. lose one of his wanted cards and place it back in the centre of the table and be shot by the other players.
When the players have played all their cards the dealer should shuffle the cards and deal them out as above.
The winner is the first person to collect three wanted cards.

137727.name: Angriff auf die Burg!
137727.description:
The knight Vincelot must save the Princess Paula from the castle of Prince Finster with the help of a catapult.
You must have a good eye and a steady hand to choose a good position for Your catapult in Your turn because good shots may give You a lot of points and even save the princess.

Player who save the princess or has a most points if players get rid of their ammo is the winner.

137728.name: Oddland
137728.description:
Become the OddLander!

Enforce the law in a post-apocalyptic future, full of mutants and bands of criminals, facing duels with all kind of enemies.
OddLand is a duel shooter that will leave you breathless!

Source: The Developer Website.

137729.name: Chōkūkan Night: Pro Yakyū King
137729.description:
User Summary

Chōkūkan Night: Pro Yakyū King ("King Choukuukan Night Baseball" in English) is a baseball game with anime-style graphics. It features teams from the Japanese professional league. It was released only in Japan for the N64. It has two play modes: one-off exhibition matches and season play. Season play involves a whole season of games with a team, allowing player trades. Each player has individual statistics, which can be improved. Athletes are controlled by individual players.

137730.name: Eine Reise ins Riesengebirge
137730.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 90 => Jannowitz, nowadays Jannowice)
learn more about Silesia, especially Riesengebirge (Sudeten Mountains)
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
Start at Hirschberg (nowadays Jelenina Góra);
(pewter) meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on lid inside.

remarks:
Background of the cover: shows giant 'Rübezahl', spirit of many Silesian fairytales;
due to Scholz' numbering system game should had been published ~ 1910

137732.name: Speed Boat
137732.description: Basic racetrack game with a speed boat theme. The playing surface is lithographic paper placed on the box bottom. First player to reach the finish with the exact number wins.

137733.name: The Chaotic Caves
137733.description:
from the title page:
A Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game Adventure
For Characters of Levels 1 to 3

Fell monsters inhabit a network of caves on the borderland between savage wilderness and frontier civilization. Can the heroic adventurers root them out and save nearby towns and villages from attack?

from the introduction:
This module provides a collection of low level, basic scenarios for anyone with simple tastes who wants something they can take and change as they wish. The text is mostly statistics; none of the creatures or characters herein are named, leaving much to the GM's imagination. If sophisticated plots are needed, the GM will have to make them up.

This adventure was designed for use with the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game, available for free from www.basicfantasy.org, but can in fact be used with a variety of “old school” fantasy RPG systems.

137734.name: Story Mixer
137734.description:
This Lego story telling game consists of a spinner with 6 directions and 30 small Lego models, each on a four by four base.
The active player spins the spinner, then places one of his/her models onto the field the spinner points to. S/he then gives the model a name made out of two words, such as "red dragon", "stomping elephant", "birthday cake", etc. and begins a story with that element. The next player does the same, but must use both the first model and his/her own (in that order!) in the story, etc. A player who makes a mistake (i.e. saying fire dragon) is penalized by having to take the model back. Elements that return to the field may be re-named, adding to the chaos. The spinner also has some color fields with special properties.
The goal of the game is to get rid of one's one models first. Of course, it can be varied by adding your own models.

Set # 50004
Item # 6024947

137735.name: Auto-Rennen
137735.description:
Objective: Be the first ending the car race by passing target space 70
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions (glued on cover inside) ending on a marked (white) space

remarks:
cute meeples (pewter figures)

137736.name: Fortress, Tomb, and Tower: The Glain Campaign
137736.description:
from the title page:
A Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game Adventure Series
For 4 to 8 Player Characters, Levels 2 to 8

publisher's blurb:
This adventure series from the World of Glain includes three distinct adventures, suitable for characters of various levels: Fortress of the Iron Duke, Tomb of Karsma Megalos, and Crooked Rock Tower.

User comment:
This reflects the publication in its most stable form, post-playtesting, in print and electronic versions.

137737.name: Crystal Warriors
137737.description:
Crystal Warriors (アーリエル クリスタル伝説?, "Ariel: Legendary Crystal") is a turn-based fantasy strategy video game for the Sega Game Gear handheld system. It was released by Sega in Japan in 1991 and North America in 1992. The animation was done by Kugatsuhime, a Japanese video game company. The gameplay of Crystal Warriors is similar to both the Shining Force and Fire Emblem series.

Game Play

The player forms a party of up to nine units to fight in each level. The player starts on one side of the map and an enemy force of up to nine units occupies a castle on the opposite side. The player must defeat the enemy force or move a unit on to the enemy castle entrance to complete each level. Each level has terrain features which form bottlenecks or change the speed of units. The player controls specialized units belonging to a particular elemental group and most of the strategy revolves around the element of a given unit and its correct usage. Each element is weak to one and strong versus another in a rock-paper-scissors system. Fire elemental units are strong against wind elemental units, while wind units are strong against water, and in turn water units are strong against fire. Earth-based units have no particular strengths or weaknesses.

Whenever a player unit attacks an enemy unit or vice versa, a battle occurs. A battle consists of two rounds where the units can fight with melee weapons, spells or monsters. The attacking unit strikes first in each round.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crystal Warriors", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

137738.name: Der Luftschutz
137738.description:
'Luftschutz' means 'civil air defence'
Objective: be the first reaching target space 100 - learn important facts to improve protection
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a marked (red) space follow instuctions printed lid inside; images on the board illustrate critical areas (education)

137739.name: Super Amazing Wagon Adventure
137739.description:
User Summary

First released as an Xbox Live Indie Games title, before being ported onto Windows, Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a retro-flavoured parody of the Oregon Trail.

Just like in the Oregon Trail, the game depicts the journey to the West in the 19th century and its many hazards, including river crossings and diseases. Unlike the original game, however, the player also encounters rabid squirrels, unicorns, volcanoes, or even crazier stuff.

Levels alternate between dual-stick shooter (when you are on foot) and side-scrolling shoot-em-up (when riding the wagon) sections.

137741.name: Morgansfort: The Western Lands Campaign
137741.description:
from the title page:
A Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game Campaign
For 2 to 8 Beginning Player Characters

from the introduction:
Morgansfort: The Western Lands Campaign is a campaign module (a group of connected adventures) for the Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game. This module is intended for 2 to 8 beginning (1st level) player characters, and furthermore is suitable for beginning players as well. There are several parts to this module:


The Western Lands, a campaign adventure area
Morgansfort, a “home base” for adventurers
The Old Island Fortress, a two-level dungeon environment suitable for beginning adventurers
The Nameless Dungeon, a three-level dungeon
The Cave of the Unknown, a one-level dungeon filled with strange monsters controlled by an unusual master


Also, a set of pregenerated characters are provided to make starting a new Basic Fantasy RPG campaign quick and easy.

137742.name: Blocks

videogamehonor.38145: 2016 Proto Awards Most Innovative Game of the Year Nominee

137742.description:
A fantastically fun and simple 2D block moving game. Easy to learn, a challenge to master. Your objective in each level is to use the ground and the movable blocks to create a path that gets you to the finish. Button based controls let you move as fast as your thumbs will let you. Included are 300 hand crafted levels ensuring a creative challenge for everyone.

Source: The Game Website.

137743.name: MLB 13: The Show

videogamehonor.31332: 2013 Spike (VGX) Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee

137743.description:
Microbadge:


The highest-rated sports videogame over the past 4 years (according to average ratings on MetaCritic.com and GameRankings.com), MLB® 13 The Show™ is once again ready to provide fans with over 50 more enhancements, new features, and improvements that will make every baseball fan think they are really living the Major League Baseball® (MLB®) experience. The Show is the most realistic baseball video game with its authentic franchise and season modes, and incredible detail not found in any other sports game.

MLB 13 The Show improves upon what has been delivered in previous franchise releases, however, The Show also adds many new features that continue to push the envelope in the sports video game genre. The Show will once again prove to be the industry’s premier licensed MLB game, both critically and commercially.

Due to hit stores on March 5, 2013, just in time for Spring Training™, as the only officially licensed first party MLB game exclusively for the PlayStation®3 (PS3™) and PlayStation®Vita (PS Vita) systems, MLB 13 The Show is prepared to deliver a one-of-a-kind experience for all fans, new and old.

Source: The Publisher Website.

137744.description:
Tessen is a card game featuring simultaneous real time play. Players take animal cards from their decks and play them in up to five groups in front of them. Players may save sets of three or more, but beware! The opponent may use a warrior card to "attack" forcing the player to give up the attacked animal cards. The attacking player may then take the cards for his own. Also, warriors may be used to "defend" and nullify an opponent's warrior.

Tessen is easy to learn, plays in minutes, and is great fun for both the casual and serious gamer.
137744.name: Tessen

137745.name: Livre des Joueurs
137745.description:
User Summary:

The Players Book contains the presentation of the Nephilim: Révélation universe, along with the rules of the game and the character creation system.

137746.name: Film Fixer
137746.description:
Game description from the back of the box:

"Film Fixer" is a card game based on the theme of the film industry. Each player becomes a producer of the movie, or hire the talent, we will increase the influence in the industry by creating a slush fund or been successful in investing, or making a movie variety. Rivals and won the "psychological warfare", it becomes "mastermind" who do you think true...

Game description from user:

"Film Fixer" is a 3-4 player card game based on the theme of producing movies in the film industry. Although this game was made in Japan, the company has made it bi-lingual (although a few of the translations are a little strage).

Each player starts with a new talent card and 8 coins. The player uses coins to purchase (contract) "talent" and sends them to "movies" in order to earn more money and victory points.

Contents:
4 - Newcomer Cards
36 - Money Cards (9/6 coins, 12/3 coins, 15/1 coins)
37 - Movie Cards (15/Talent cards, 11/QE Film cards, 11/CP Film cards)
1 - The End Card

Each turn is conducted in 6 phases:

1 - Investment
2 - Change
3 - Contracting
4 - Shooting
5 - Profit
6 - Replenishing

The instructions provided are a little confusing at first, but I'll do my best to try and summarize them.

The movie cards (talent and film cards) are shuffled, the END card is placed two from the bottom, and 5 cards are dealt into the play area.

1 - In the investment phase non-acting players can invest money in what they think the acting player will do. Money cards each have one of three logos on them: Yukidama Agency Corp. (for all talent cards [YA]), Qvinta Essentia Entertainment Inc. [QP] and Cosaic Pictures Inc. [CP] (the two movie companies). The invested money is placed face down and players wait until phase 5 (where they see if the acting player has played any of the companies non-acting players have invested in.

2 - In the change phase the acting player can choose to pay one coin to switch out one movie card with a new one. They can do this as many times as they'd like as long as they have the money to do so. They do not receive change from this transaction.

3 - In the contracting phase the acting player can purchase "talent" which will be placed face up infront of them. Talent often have various abilities that will affect play. In this phase, players can receive change from this transaction.

4 - In the shooting phase the acting player sends talent (this includes their "new talent" card) to film cards (if any in the play area). They can send multiple talent to work on different films as long as those films are being produced by the same company (you can't send one talent to CP and one to QE in the same turn. Either one or the other). You can also send multiple talent to the same film (as co-stars). The acting player will collect money and the film card (film cards go into the victory point pile). If the sent talent card has a star mark on it, it is discarded.

5 - In the profit phase the other players will collect their reward if they properly invested their money (for example: If player B decides to invest a "one coin" card with the CP logo on it and the acting player (player A) sends tallent to a CP film, then player B will be rewarded [they can either put the invested money into their VP pile or upgrade it to the next higher value coin card]). If the non-acting player invested in the wrong company, that invested money is discarded.

6 - In the replenish phase new movie cards are dealt into the play area until there are 5 cards again. It is now the next player's turn and it becomes the investment phase again.

Once the END card is dealt, the game will finish after the "next" player's turn. Once finished, each player counts their Victory Points. Player with the most VP is the winner (if tie, the player who made the most movies wins).

137747.name: Moony's Seaside Game
137747.description:
Moony decided to go to the seaside for the day. Here is a jolly seaside game for you to play with your friends. You need counters - small buttons will do - and a dice. At some of the spaces there are things that happen to Moony on the way to the seaside. Remember, he can change into anything just by thinking about it! You have to do what the words in those spaces tell you. The first player to get to the seaside, is the winner.

Published in the Playhour Annual, 1976

137748.name: "Beware Planet Earth!"
137748.description:
Heed the warning from the red planet, Earthlings! The Martians are about to strike our beloved planet to take our single most valuable resource: cows! Protect Barney's "ladies" in this colorful and whimsical tower defense game!

- Full Story Mode (46 levels over 4 seasons), plus 18 bonus challenges!
- Two game modes: Veteran mode for experienced players, and normal mode for beginners to the tower defence genre.
- Intense action! Grab your Zapper to attack the Martians and overpower your machines!
- 20 wacky machines, from the classic defense tower to the Helicowpter!
- Over 20 quirky Martians, from the Metalhead to the Mad Scientist to the Ninja!
- 27 Achievements!
- Cows!

Source: The Developer Website.

137749.name: Quizball
137749.description:
Trivia meets football.

The board represents a football pitch with coloured circles. When you answer a question correctly, you throw the die and move forward. The nearer you get to your opponent's goal, the harder the questions.

After 90 minutes of play, the player or team with the most goals, wins.

137750.description:
Libra symbolizes balance and harmony.

LIBRA was invented by Néstor Romeral Andrés on January 2013.

LIBRA is a 2-player board game of asymmetrical goals played on a hexagonal grid of any shape and size. Two players (MORE and LESS) share a common pool of stones in two colours. MORE will try to create as many groups of connected stones of the same colour as possible, while LESS will try to avoid that many groups from being created.

LIBRA combines these well known mechanics into a new interesting game:

- MORE vs LESS (asymmetrical goal)
- Group counting
- Placement of any colour

COMPONENTS

- A hexagonal grid of any size and shape. For beginners, a hexagon of 5 cells per side is recommended.
- A supply of stones in 2 colours.

The nestorgames edition will include around 200 stones in two colours and a hexagonal board (with 5, 6 or 7 hexes per side depending on skill level).

GAMEPLAY

There are 2 types of gameplay:

Duel: The game takes place over two rounds. In the first round, one player plays as ‘MORE’, the other as ‘LESS’. In the second round, the roles reverse. Whoever creates more groups playing the ‘MORE’ role wins the game.

Bid: Before the game starts players take turns announcing how many groups they think they can create, raising the number each time. The player that passes first plays as ‘LESS’, and the other player plays as ‘MORE’ and must create at least as many groups as she bid to win.

RULES

Starting with ‘LESS’, players alternate turns placing a stone of any colour on an empty cell of the board. The game ends when all the cells have been occupied (or by mutual consent).

Count the number of groups of connected stones for both colours. This is the ‘MORE’ score. Isolated stones are also considered groups.
137750.name: Libra

137751.description:
Hong, named after a two-headed dragon in Chinese mythology, is a tile-laying game of asymmetrical goals for two players, invented in December 2012 by Néstor Romeral Andrés. Two players – MORE and LESS – share a common pool of identical squared pieces depicting two dragon heads and one dragon segment. A hong is a straight line of one or more segments with a dragon head on each end. The MORE player must create as many hongs as possible, while the LESS player must prevent that many hongs from being created.

Note that open-ended dragons or pairs of heads with no segments in between them are not hongs.
137751.name: Hong

137752.name: Legion of Primus: Roll into Action
137752.description:
Legion of Primus: Roll into Action is a game of battling Super heroes and Super Villians.

It is a push your luck dice game played on a battle board.

Each character has a unique set of powers and these powers are activated by Cubitos energy, the more energy the stronger the powers are that they can activate.
Players roll different dice to try and gain the correct energy symbols for their Powers, but roll to many OverLoad symbols and the character cannot activate this turn. Players also have the chance to unleash defensive powers in their opponents turn.

137755.name: Gnome Wars
137755.description:
